tourName: 3 Day Gorilla trekking holiday in Rwanda
generalInfo:
Situated in northwestern Rwanda, Volcanoes National Park is one of the country’s most popular tourist destinations. Get the opportunity to experience gorilla trekking which is purely a life-changing adventure which rewards travelers with close encounter to the endangered mountain gorillas in their natural habitats. Beyond gorillas, however, the park is also able to offer some of the country’s most spectacular scenery and diverse vegetation. In addition to mountain gorillas, Volcanoes national park is home to golden monkeys (Cercopithecus mitis kandti), Spotted Hyena, buffaloes, elephants, black-fronted duiker, and bushbuck. The park also harbors 178 bird species including at least 29 endemics to Rwenzori mountains and the Virungas.
Experienced guides will take you through this impressive montane ecosystem, where you can witness the sights and sounds of the heart of Africa.

dayInfo.description: KIGALI A warm welcome awaits you upon touch down in Kigali by our driver guide will transport you to your luxury hotel to relax and recharge during your brief stay in Rwanda’s capital. Meal Plan: Breakfast RWANDA: Lying at the heart of Africa, Rwanda is one of the most dynamic leisure destinations, offering vibrant cities, pristine wilderness, and an exceptionally hospitable people. A unique and largely undiscovered venue, Rwanda also offers unrivalled biodiversity, beautiful mountains, some of the oldest and most precious rain forest on earth, five volcanoes, 23 lakes, numerous waterfalls and three stunning national parks. Regarding wildlife, Rwanda boasts 13 species of primates (25% of the total number in Africa) and 670 species of birds, many of which are globally endangered. Sports lovers, meanwhile, can enjoy walking, trekking or mountain biking along thousands of pristine trails, mountaineering, volcano exploration, fishing, boating and a plethora of water sports, while cultural options include a traditional dance, historical sites and displays of ethnic art and heritage.

KIGALI/VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK After breakfast you will visit the genocide museum and enjoy a city tour of Kigali. After lunch, depart on scenic drive Northwest wards through the beautiful, terraced hillsides that display Rwanda’s landscape. Arrive at Ruhengeri, the base for gorilla trekking at the Parc National des Volcans. The town itself is located only 25km from Uganda boarder, is relatively a small city of about 70,000 people. The constant flow of humanity is quite remarkable. The Town has great views of the surrounding volcanoes. People are very friendly here and although a former Belgian colony (and thus French-speaking), many people speak English here. Meal Plan: Full Board

GORILLA TREKKING Today after an early breakfast you will drive a short distance to the park headquarters for a briefing where you will be assigned a family of gorillas to visit. The trek takes about 2 to 4 hrs. When visiting the ‘Land of a thousand Hills, one should not miss out on the magnificent opportunity to visit Volcanoes National Park consisting of 125 km2 of mountain forest and home to the six Virunga Volcanoes and the world-famous mountain gorillas. Protected within the PNV, the lushly forested slopes of the mountains form an appropriately dramatic natural setting for what is arguably the most poignant and memorable wildlife experience in the world: gorilla trekking. The exhilarating climb to the gorilla’s natural habitat of shady bamboo forest offers fantastic views in all directions, before the trackers are immersed in the mysterious intimacy of the rainforest, alive with the calls of colorful birds and the chattering of rare golden monkey. Nothing can prepare one for the impact of encountering a fully-grown silverback gorilla, up to three times the size of an average man, yet remarkably peaceable and tolerant of human visitors. Please remember to bring your passport for registration, appropriate waterproof hiking boots, and a light raincoat. To protect from stinging nettles, we recommend long pants and long-sleeved tops. A pair of old gardening gloves can help grabbing onto the vegetation while most hotels/lodges provide a walking stick that come in very handy especially when hiking downhill. A small waterproof backpack is an excellent idea to carry a light snack, bottled water as well as protection for your camera. Upon sighting the gorillas, you spend the allowed one hour with them as they go about their daily life; feeding, moving, playing, raising their young and sometimes wrestling with the juveniles – it is a totally unique and unforgettable experience! Meal Plan: Full Board

VOLCANOES/KIGALI/DEPARTURE After a sumptuous breakfast at the hotel, we bid farewell to the staff and the friends we met here, thereafter take a leisurely drive to Kigali, drop off at the Airport for your outbound flight. MEAL PLAN: BREAKFAST

tourName: 3 day Rwanda gorilla safari
placesVisited: Kigali, Genocide Memorial site at Gisozi, Ruhengeri, Volcanoes National Park, Virunga Mountains, Gorilla trekking
generalInfo:
A three day Rwanda holiday that includes not only one full day on a gorilla safari, one of the world’s most sought after wildlife watching experiences, but also a guided tour around the country’s historic capital, Kigali, a city that has been the centre of clan led kingdoms for generations and then colonial powers after that. The horrors of the 1994 genocide are commemorated at Gisozi, a memorial site on the outskirts of the city, which you will visit.

From the turbulent past to the tranquillity of the hills, where the Volcanoes National Park boasts not only an extraordinary landscape of nine volcanoes, six of which are active, but also habitats for the world famous mountain gorilla. Enjoy a day trekking with expert guides through these beautifully biodiverse, elevated forests in search of the greatest primates of them all.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at the Kigali International Airport you will be met and transferred to the Flame Tree Village in the heart of Kigali city. Overnight at the hotel on bed and breakfast basis (Dinner is on own arrangement)

After breakfast, embark on a City Tour of Kigali. Learn the history behind Rwanda through the tales told by its capital; get acquainted with pre-colonial and colonial Rwanda, the 1994 genocide and see the new developments. A visit to the genocide memorial site at Gisozi, about 35km outside the city centre, is the highlight of the city tour. This visit is an emotional experience for most visitors as they encounter the horrid massacre that engulfed the country in 1994. It also presents an opportunity to learn about other genocides in the world. You then have lunch at a local restaurant in Kigali After lunch, depart Kigali on a scenic drive north-westwards to Ruhengeri at the foothills of the Virunga volcanoes. Enjoy the picturesque countryside as you drive on to check-in to the Gorilla Mountain View Lodge for dinner and overnight.

After an early breakfast at the lodge, transfer to the Volcanoes National Park at 0630. Arrive at the park headquarters for registration - a simple process where the park staff asses your fitness level to determine which Gorilla Family you will visit. Thereafter, the park staff brief on trekking times and conditions to the various groups based upon their location in the park the previous evening. There are a total of 80 gorilla permits available each day with a maximum of 8 trekkers visiting any one group. Treks vary in duration depending on which gorilla group you are assigned to. After locating your assigned gorilla group, you will spend approximately one hour in their company before heading back down the volcano slopes. The park is located in the Virunga Mountains, a magnificent chain of dormant volcanoes in the north of Rwanda which it shares with the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and Uganda. The mountains form part of the extension of the Congo-Nile divide, separating two of Africa´s most important watersheds. They are also home to the world’s last surviving Mountain Gorilla populations, currently about 700 individuals. After a great gorilla trekking experience, drive south-eastwards back to Kigali City. Transfer to Kigali International Airport for your departure flight.

tourName: 4 day primate and cultural tour, Rwanda
generalInfo:
On this safari, you will experience the scenery, nature and wildlife of Rwanda. Drive to the twin lakes in northern Rwanda for an experience taking a canoe on the beautiful lake with views of the Virunga's.

After this experience, leave for volcanoes national park where you will track the mountain gorillas, golden monkeys and a cultural experience at the gorilla guardians village. End the tour exploring Kigali city – visit the genocide memorial, Nyirambo women’s center and craft market.

dayInfo.description: TO VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK | CANOEING ON RIVER MUKUNGWA: Have breakfast and after leave for canoeing on river Mukungwa. Enjoy a canoe ride on the river with views of the Virunga volcanoes and neighbouring villages. After the experience, leave for Volcanoes national park. Check into your lodge for an exciting Rwanda gorilla trekking experience tomorrow.

GORILLA TREKKING & GORILLA GUARDIANS VILLAGE: Start the Rwanda gorilla trek with a briefing from the ranger guides at the park headquarters. After the brief, join a gorilla group with guidance from your tour guide. Depending on location of gorilla family, you might have to drive to the trail head. After one hour with the gorillas, you start your hike out of the park. Your driver guide will pick you up and transfer you to the lodge for down time. After the gorilla trekking experience, leave for a community experience. Learn about the culture and history of Rwanda. Try out your bow and arrow shooting skills or basketry etc.

HIKE DIAN FOSSEY GRAVE: Your driver guide will transfer you for briefing at the park headquarter about the expectations while you the hike. After the briefing, your driver guide will transfer you to the trail head which is about 30 minutes drive on a bumpy road. Start the trek up to the park boundary where it is separated from the community. There are porters at the this point and you are advised to take one. Taking a porter gives community people opportunities for work. On the park boundary you will meet armed soldiers who will escort you on your hike to the mountain because the mountain is home to Elephants and Buffaloes which can be dangerous.

GOLDEN MONKEY TREKKING & DEPARTURE Return to the park headquarters for briefing before you can go for your golden monkey trekking experience. After the briefing - leave for the experience in the park. You are allowed one hour after which you exit the park. Return to the lodge for lunch and thereafter depart for Kigali.

tourName: Best of Rwanda safari, 12 days
generalInfo:
On this trip, you will experience the beauty of Rwanda – the “land of a thousand Hills.” Enjoy the different backdrops and Landscape of Rwanda as you turn along the hilly roads. The national parks are a mixture of savannah, forest, and mountainous. Enjoy time in the tropical forest of Nyungwe as you trek Chimpanzees and Colobus monkeys and the mighty mountain gorillas and golden monkeys in the Volcanoes national park.

Safari Highlights

• Chimpanzee tracking
• Colobus monkey trekking
• Canopy Walk in Nyungwe Forest
• Gorilla tracking in Volcanoes
• Golden monkey trekking
• Gorilla Guardians Village
• Game drive
• Boat ride

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN KIGALI Welcome to Rwanda the land of “a thousand hills.” Our guide/ representative staff will be at the airport to pick you.

EXPLORE KIGALI CITY Drive through the fast growing neighborhoods of Kigali that are changing the face of the city. Visit the Nyamirambo women’s Centre and see the amazing artisan work by these women. Visit the Kigali genocide memorial site commemorating the 1994 Rwandan Genocide. Kimironko market to buy crafts and also enjoy sights of Kigali.

TRANSFER TO NYUNGWE FOREST | ETHNNOGRAPHIC MUSEUM: We shall stopover in Huye and visit the national museum to learn more about the history and traditions of the Rwanda people. Arrive in Nyungwe forest later in the evening.

CHIMPANZEE TREKKING AND CANOY WALK: After an early breakfast, we leave for Chimpanzee tracking in Nyungwe forest. The forest is rich in botanical diversity and home to 13 species of primates including Chimpanzees, L’Hoest monkeys, and Columbus monkeys with 300 bird species. Your tour guide will transfer you to the briefing area where you will meet your ranger guide and receive briefing before you start your trek. Return to lodge after the chimp trek or you can choose to do the Canopy walk immediately so that you rest once. The canopy walk allows you beautiful views of the forest from above as you admire nature.

COLOBUS MONKEY TREKKING & TRANSFER TO LAKE KIVU This morning again we leave for the briefing point at the Nyungwe forest. After briefing, the ranger guide will lead you into the forest for the Colobus monkey trekking. Look forward to experiencing playful interactions of the monkeys as they groom, feed and play for each other. You are allowed 1 hour in their presence before you start the trek back. Leave for the beautiful Lake Kivu after the Colobus monkey trekking. Continue to your hotel along Lake Kivu. Relax at the lakeside in the evening sipping a way to your favourite drink.

LAKE KIVU AND ENVIRONS Have a lazy morning and later take a boat ride on Lake Kivu. Depending on one’s interests, you can engage on kayaking on lake kivu. This can be arranged by your tour guide if it is of interest to you. (Optional and would be paid for out of pocket)
TO VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK Start the journey to Volcanoes national park with a stopover visit at the former Imbabazi orphanage and learn about the transformation work they do in this area.

GORILLA TREKKING & ELLEN DEGENERES CAMPUS Meet the mountain gorillas in the dense jungles of the Virunga ranges. The trek to the gorillas starts with a briefing at the park headquarters in Kinigi where you are assigned a ranger and gorilla family to trek. After briefing, your ranger guide leads you to the starting point of the trek. You might need to drive to the starting point of the trek depending on location of gorilla family you are trekking. The trek through the habitat of these enormous animals is a fulfilling unforgettable experience that many people look to undertake. The trek can last from a few minutes to several hours depending on where the gorillas nested the previous night. After the gorilla trek, you can choose to visit the Diani Fossey Museum. You are required to give a donation as a way to support the work.

GOLDEN MONKEY TREKKING AND GORILLA GUARDIANS Just like yesterday, your driver guide will transfer you to the park headquarters for briefing before you can start your trek. Golden monkeys are generally more active than gorillas and will require you to move as you follow them foraging for food. Once you locate them, you are only allowed to stay with them for 1 hour after which you start the trek back. Use the afternoon to visit the gorilla guardians village where you will learn more about the Rwandan culture. Become a King or Queen for a day, get involved in knitting, learn how to use a bow and arrow.

TRANSFER TO AKAGERA NATIONAL PARK We leave for Akagera national park in the morning after your breakfast. The journey to the park is about 5 hours depending on the stopovers along the way. On arrival at the park, we shall proceed to our accommodation for check in. After lunch you will take a boat safari on Lake Ihema for a beautiful afternoon breeze and some sighting of birds and wildlife. You will have a night game drive today or tomorrow in search of mostly the nocturnal animals that are difficult to see during the day.

GAME DRIVE Akagera National Park is a Savannah park with Elephants, Hippos, Buffaloes and Lions. After an early breakfast we take a game drive in search of these animals, the game drive will take us to the northern part of the park where most of the animals prefer to inhabit. Look out for the Zebras, Giraffes and Impalas which are usually scattered along the game tracks.
TRANSFER TO KIGALI FOR DEPARTURE Today is your last day on this Kagera Safaris – Rwanda wildlife safari. Start your day with breakfast and transfer to the airport.

tourName: Gorilla and chimpanzee tracking holiday in Rwanda
generalInfo:
Welcome to the "land of a thousand hills". Come meet with the friendly locals and track the mountain gorillas and chimpanzees. This private tailor made Rwanda tour has been designed to bring you in close contact with all of the highlights of this fascinating country Including chimps in Nyungwe Forest, The incredible Gorillas in Volcanoes forests, Golden monkeys and many others
The trip begins in Kigali and end in Kigali one of Africa's cleanest city.
You will be staying in well-situated great accommodation with friendly staff.

dayInfo.description: Welcome To rwanda - Your Rwanda gorilla adventure begins here Upon arrival at Kigali international Airport you will be picked up and driven to your hotel Depending on your arrival time, you may be able to visit some of Kigali’s craft markets to browse amongst the pottery, carvings, batik, weaving, sculpture, musical instruments, leather and fabrics on offer. Prepare to use your haggling skills! All activities and purchases today are at your own cost

In the morning, you will meet your driver/guide and you will set off towards the famous Nyungwe Forest one of the largest forests in East and Central Africa. The forest is abundant with flora and fauna including 13 primate species from colobus monkeys, mangabeys, blue monkeys and, of course, our cousins the chimpanzees. Nyungwe Forest is also a famous location for birders. With about 310 recorded bird species, 26 of which are endemic, this is one of the most important - and still little known - bird-watching destinations in Africa.

After a very early morning start, you will proceed to the chimpanzee-tracking trail in either the Cyamudongo or Uwinka sections. The total population between the two groups is a healthy 80 individuals. This exciting up-close encounter with human's closest relative you will not soon forget. After the chimp tracking you can relax at the lodge or choose an optional activity that you can discuss with your guide

Nyungwe to Lake Kivu Kibuye area After breakfast, you will travel to Kibuye on the eastern shores of Lake Kivu. Time allowing, you can visit the Ndaba Falls or take a walk around Kibuye town. In the afternoon you can you can rent a boat and visit a few islands. All activities today are at your own cost.

Today you shall drive northeast to the town of Musanze close to the Virunga Volcano range. This beautiful area represents the gateway to the gorilla tracking Your lodge for tonight is located near the entrance of the national park with an amazing view overlooking the Virunga Volcanoes. From here you will start your Gorilla tracking tomorrow

Today you will start early! From the lodge, you drive into the park about 30 minutes to the Office Rwandais du Tourisme et Des Parc Nationaux (ORTPN). The head ranger of the ORTPN will divide you into groups based on interest and fitness. From here your driver/guide will take you as close as possible to the starting point of your tracking. Today you will track one of the habituated Gorilla groups who can tolerate the presence of humans for a brief period every day. The time taken to track the gorillas can take as little as half an hour to as much as 8 hours!

Today after a relaxed breakfast, your driver/guide shall transfer you back to Kigali. Today you can visit the Genocide Memorial and Education Centre, which opened in 2004. It is a dignified tribute to the victims, including a poignant Children’s Memorial, and a detailed description of the darkest hour in Rwanda's recent history in time to catch your flight back home. Your driver/guide will take you to the airport in time for your flight home. Sadly, this is where you say goodbye to Rwanda.

dayInfo.description: TO VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK - CANOEING ON RIVER MUKUNGWA: Your driver guide will pick you up from the airport or your hotel. You will then transfer to Volcanoes national park for a down time as you prepare for gorilla trekking the next day. Depending on your arrival time – you will have a short Kigali city tour OR Canoeing on River Mukungwa

After the brief, join a gorilla group with guidance from your tour guide. Depending on location of gorilla family, you might have to drive to the trail head. Start the gorilla trek and after one hour with the gorillas, you start your hike out of the park. Your driver guide will pick you up and transfer you to the lodge for down time. After the gorilla experience, visit the gorilla guardians village and learn about the culture and history of Rwanda. Try out your bow and arrow shooting skills or basketry etc.

GOLDEN MONKEY TREK | KIGALI – DEPARTURE Golden monkeys are in the Virunga volcanoes of Uganda, Rwanda and DR Congo. After a short brief from the ranger guide, you will start your hike up in search of the golden monkeys. The golden monkeys are more active than the gorillas and you will follow them as they move to feed. Like gorilla trekking, you are only allowed 1 hour with the golden monkey. Return to the lodge, freshen up and have lunch. After this, leave for the airport/hotel in Kigali.

tourName: Gorilla safari & holiday in Rwanda, tailor made
placesVisited: Kigali, Butare, Nyungwe Forest National Park, gorillas, chimpanzees and pied colobus monkeys, Kivu Lake, Karisoke research centre, Volcanoes National Park, Virunga Volcanoes, Gorilla Mountain View Lodge
generalInfo:
The perfect setting for a unique gorilla safari, Rwanda is made up of essential hillside habitat for primates with gorillas, chimpanzees and pied colobus monkeys all occupying individual areas hidden from the view of casual tourists and potential harm from poachers.

This eleven day Rwanda gorilla watching tour takes travellers from the genocide memorials and museums of Kigali to the city of Butare, further south, before heading to the incredible protected environment of Nyungwe Forest National Park where guided chimp trekking tours set the scene for more animal adventures to come.

Although we can never guarantee a sighting of any animal there's every chance of spotting monkeys leaping amongst the forest canopy and a huge range of bird species flitting amongst the foliage; so keep your eyes peeled and listen to guide instructions prior to preparing for your next destination, the banks of Kivu Lake which can be found close to the town of Gisenyi.

After leaving Gisenyi the experience of gorilla trekking Rwanda really starts to come to fruition as you continue your journey onwards to the former research centre of Karisoke which lies within the formidable Volcanoes National Park and the realm of renowned zoologist Dian Fossey.

Although gorilla trekking in Rwanda isn't just a walk in the park every available option has been included within this tour to try to maximise gorilla watching potential with treks timed to coincide with primate resting periods to ensure travellers get a full hour of pure, unadulterated, viewing pleasure.

Weather within Volcanoes National Park is at the mercy of the gods although, in the main, the spring (April/May) is regarded as the wet season; although there's still every chance of seeing gorillas in the mist so long as you're aware of the increased rain that lies ahead.

June's Gorilla Naming Ceremony is an annual event to mark the one year birthdays of the national park's gorilla community with Rwandan officials marking the occasion with a few words as well as plenty of traditional African music and dancing festivities.

'Adopting' a gorilla and giving generously to fund raising efforts is the best way to enable funds to go to the right place with resources, such as: anti-poaching patrols and providing extra park rangers, adding to the security to both the habitat and lifestyles of Rwandan gorillas as well as the safety of visiting responsible travellers.

dayInfo.description: You'll depart on your overnight flight today.

You'll arrive in Kigali this morning and will be met by your driver-guide and private vehicle which will accompany you for the duration of your journey around Rwanda. In Kigali, you have the rest of the day to relax after your long flights, or you can set off on foot to explore this friendly and clean capital city. You'll spend the night at Kigali Serena.

This morning you'll head off with your driver-guide and private vehicle to Nyungwe Forest. The route takes you through rolling hills and beautiful scenery. You'll stop in the town of Butare, Rwanda's second largest city and the former capital, for a break at midday and to visit the national museum and university before reaching Nyungwe Top View Hotel in the afternoon, where you will spend 2 nights.

Today you will set off after breakfast to meet your guide and start your trek to see the chimps - you can enjoy looking for other primates, birds and animals along the way. Your guide will teach you about tracking the chimpanzees, pointing out signs they've left as you head through the forest. Upon reaching them you'll be able to see them playing and interacting in their natural habitat - an incredible sight.

This morning you will drive from Nyungwe along the shore of Lake Kivu to Gisenyi - you'll start off inland and then head west, enjoying beautiful views of the lake and mountain scenery on the way. You'll then have 2 nights to relax at the Lake Kivu Serena.

Today is free for relaxing or exploring Lake Kivu - you can go swimming in the hotel pool, or in the lake itself, have a tour of Ginsenyi town, or hire a boat to visit some of the nearby islands on the lake. You can decide on the day what you'd like to do and your driver will help with all of your arrangements.

After breakfast you will set off for Ruhengeri at the base of the Volcanoes National Park. The drive takes about an hour and a half, and will begin with a steep incline up over the dramatic cliff-like hills which then become softer and more rolling as you continue inland. You can get settled into your room at Gorilla Mountain View Lodge and spend the rest of the day relaxing in your room or taking a stroll around the property. You're here for the next 3 nights.

Today you will set off early after breakfast for the park headquarters for a briefing from your guide. You will then be driven to the trailhead to start your trek. Trackers leave before the tourist groups to locate the gorilla groups so your guide should know where to take you, and once you've found the group you will have one hour with them to take photos and watch them interact - a truly memorable experience!

Trek to visit Karisoke, the former research centre of Dian Fossey, where she was buried. The trek takes most of the day, and your guide will show you around the huts where Fossey and her team started researching the mountain gorillas. This is a really interesting excursion, and the strenuous trek makes you really appreciate how remote and far from civilisation Dian Fossey and her fellow researchers were when Karisoke was in operation.

You'll depart for Kigali after breakfast, enjoying a city tour with your guide. The Gisozi Genocide Memorial is highly recommended, and if you want to buy some souvenirs, the Caplaki Handicraft market is the place to go. In the late afternoon you will be driven to the airport for your flight from Kigali to Nairobi. You will remain in transit here and board the overnight flight back to London Heathrow.
You'll arrive in London early in the morning.

tourName: Highlights of Uganda & Rwanda holiday
generalInfo: This safari will give you the high lights for Uganda and Rwanda travel - providing opportunities for viewing nature and wildlife in both countries. Start the safari visiting the Rhinos at the Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary after which you proceed to the top of the falls in Murchison falls national park. Kibale national park which is home to 13 primate species with the main attraction being chimpanzees will be your next destination. After the experience with chimpanzees in Kibale you will visit “the medley of wonders” – Queen Elizabeth national park for a range of wildlife and beautiful scenery of crater lakes. Next will be the Bwindi impenetrable national park for the ultimate gorilla trekking experience and Lake Bunyonyi for a down time recouping the energies.  Continue on to Volcanoes national park meeting the cheeky golden monkeys and a visit to the gorilla guardians village. End with relaxing time along Lake Kivu.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL IN UGANDA: You will be picked up from the airport and transferred to your hotel. Depending on time of arrival, you will have an evening sunset cruise on Lake Victoria.

ZIWA RHINO SANCTUARY | ENCOUNTER THE RHINOS: Depart for Murchison falls National Park right after an early breakfast. Enjoy the views of the scenery of Uganda along the way and colorful roadside markets. Stop at the Ziwa Rhino sanctuary to learn about the conservation of Rhinos at this sanctuary and watch them as they graze and go about in this vast sanctuary. After this, proceed to the park and visit the top of the falls.

MURCHISON FALLS | THE WATERS OF THE NILE Murchison Falls National park is the biggest park in Uganda offering amazing game viewing. Start early with a game drive on the Northern bank of River Nile. Watch the different animals and birds in their natural habitat. During the game drive look out for bush bucks, water bucks, buffaloes, giraffes, elephants, lions, hartebeest, leopards, Uganda kobs and bird species. In the afternoon, join in a relaxing boat ride. Look out for animals coming to water and those resident /semi residents like Hippos, crocodiles, and monitor lizards.

KIBALE NATIONAL PARK | HOME OF CHIMPANZEES Today we depart for the home of Chimpanzee in Kibale National Park. Kibale forest is home to 13 species of primates with the main attraction being chimpanzee tracking and bird watching. The journey to this tropical forest passes villages and colorful road markets. Have a visit to the Amabere Ganyina mwiru caves in Fort portal town and enjoy the stories about these fascinating caves with waterfalls.

CHIMP TREKKING & BIGODI VILLAGE Today after breakfast, embark on the chimpanzee trekking activity. Chimpanzees share 98.7% of man’s DNA and are referred to as man’s closest relatives. The trek starts with a briefing from your ranger guide about your chimpanzee trek. This experience offers you an opportunity to view these primates in their natural habitat. After locating the chimpanzees, you are allowed to spend one hour watching them. In the afternoon, take a walk in the Bigodi community and interact with the locals. Get a coffee experience, banana beer making experience, basketry and listen from the medicine man about how he deals with different diseases.

QUEEN ELIZABETH | THE WILDERNESS EXPERIENCE After that exhilarating experience with the chimps in their natural habitat, journey to Queen Elizabeth National Park passing through Crater lakes region (depending on road condition) and enjoying views of the Rwenzori mountain ranges. Have a stopover at the Rwenzori Sculptors gallery depending on your interest. Visit the Katwe salt mines.

GAME DRIVE AND BOAT SAFARI After an early breakfast we leave for a game drive joining the lion research team on lion tracking and supporting their work. The car is customized for game viewing, enjoy the exotic and rare species which include Elephants, Lions, Leopards, Buffaloes and Uganda Kobs etc. In the afternoon take boat safari on Kazinga Channel – towards Lake Edward with different animals on its banks and beautiful species of birds.

BWINDI FOREST | EXPLORE THE WILD Leave after breakfast for Bwindi impenetrable National Park. The park is home to several bird species, butterflies, primates and mammals. The drive takes you through beautiful scenery of terraced hills of Kigezi highlands. The locals terrace these hills as they prepare gardens for planting potatoes.

UGANDA GORILLA TREKKING EXPERIENCE Hike the impenetrable forest in search of the endangered mountain gorillas. First, you will listen to a briefing from the ranger guide. After this, you are allocated a gorilla family to track and you join other people in this group. The trail head for some of the gorilla groups are away from the briefing point so your guide will drive you to starting point. Enjoy the day in the impenetrable forest, you have up to one hour with the gorillas once you locate them. You are advised to keep reasonable silence while watching them.

VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK – TWIN LAKES After the gorilla trek in Bwindi impenetrable national park you will transfer to Volcanoes national park today. Enjoy the varying scenery of Uganda and Rwanda along the way. On arrival you will check in to your lodge and relax as you look forward to tomorrow’s activities.

GOLDEN MONKEYS & GORILLA GUARDIANS VILLAGE After an early morning breakfast, we travel to the briefing point where the golden monkey trekking starts. A ranger guide will lead you to hike up in search of the golden monkeys, which are only in the Virunga Volcanoes. The golden monkeys are such amazing creatures to watch as they jump from tree to tree. They are very active unlike the gorillas, so you will move a distance following them. Visit the gorilla guardians village where you will learn more about the Rwandan culture. Become a King or Queen for a day, get involved in knitting, learn how to use a bow and arrow.
TRANSFER TO LAKE KIVU. After this experience transfer to Lake Kivu for a down time unwinding from all the travel experiences especially the hiking experiences.

LAKE KIVU | BOAT RIDE This will be more of a rest day for you to think through your entire journey exploring Rwanda on the shores to the beautiful lake Kivu. The activities you can engage in include a visit to the to the hot springs, take a boat trip to an island, kayaking on lake kivu, visit DR Congo – Rwanda border, and relax at the lakeside in the evening sipping a way to your favourite.
TRANSFER TO KIGALI | DEPARTURE We hope you had a fantastic time in Uganda and Rwanda. Your guide will transfer you to Kigali for a short Kigali city tour and later to the airport.

tourName: Primate tour in Rwanda and Uganda
placesVisited: Primate watching and chimp tracking in Kibale National Park, Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park, Mountain Gorilla trekking in Bwindi and Volcanoes National Park, Golden monkey watching in Volcanoes National Park, Angolan Colobus watching in Nyungwe Forest National Park, Chimpanzee and blue monkey tracking in Nyungwe Forest National Park, Kigali Genocide Memorial Centre
generalInfo:
There aren't many tour operators working within the forests of Rwanda and Uganda which offer quite as extensive an amount of time in the presence of mountain gorillas and chimpanzees as you’ll find in the 11 day tailor made itinerary below.

We include not one but two gorilla tracking days; one in Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park in Uganda and one in the famous Volcanoes National Park in Rwanda.

By visiting these two parks and spending a couple of hours with the gorillas you will be able to compare the differences between habitats, behaviours and populations. Bwindi is more tropical than Volcanoes and the gorillas here seem intermediary as they travel between the eastern lowland populations in the Democratic Republic of Congo and the ‘true’ mountain gorillas of the Virungas, further south.

Some scientists are prepared to list the Bwindi population as a new sub-species which would make them the rarest type of primate on the planet. You will probably see around 20 individual gorillas, this corresponds with 2-3% of the global population. When you think about it like that you realise the importance of conservation for these magnificent animals and how privileged you'll be witnessing them first- hand.

We also follow a group of around 150 habituated chimps from dawn to see them rise and go about their daily business until they start to make their nests and settle for the night. You will follow the dominate males and their females and infants as they feed, play, rest, groom and possibly hunt (a hunt occurs roughly once a month). This is the best way to see chimps exhibit a range of behaviours and experience how scientists study this amazing ape.

As well as spending some magical time with mountain gorillas and chimps we will also aim to observe over 10 species of primates, including: red-tailed monkeys, black-and-white colobus, golden monkeys, blue monkeys, Uganda red colobus, Uganda mangabey and Demidoff’s dwarf galago.

This tour is a must for anyone who has ever wanted to walk in the footsteps of the great primatologists Dian Fossey and Jane Goodall. And you can rest assured that you are directly contributing to the continued research and conservation ethics of these primate pioneers.

All in all this really is the most comprehensive primate tour of Africa and one which will not disappoint.

Fitness levels required:

The trekking for gorillas can be strenuous as the conditions may be muddy and steep. We have no real way of knowing how far away the gorilla families will be so there could be a hike of up to 4 hours until we come across the gorillas. So a good level of fitness is required and participants must be used to walking. The chimpanzee full day habituation experience requires a good level of fitness as the walking will be through hot and humid dense rainforest. Chimps can move quickly through the forest and to follow them can mean marches for 30mins, or so, until we catch up with them again. The experience can finish whenever you wish but we can be there for 12 hours, so be prepared for a long day walking through the forest. The gorilla tracking in Bwindi National Park (Uganda) can be between 1 and 4 hours and the ridges here are very steep, the tracking in Volcanoes National Park (Rwanda) can also be between 1 and 4 hours long and include steep climbs. Both places are dense with vegetation and the weather can be either cool and wet or hot and sunny. We require all guests to be aware of the physical effort needed to see wild chimps and gorillas and require everyone to have a good level of fitness and be used to hill walking.

Equipment list:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; but as a rule of thumb we recommend you bring along your own binoculars or spotting scope (although this is not always very useful in the forests) as well as appropriate clothing; which should be hard wearing clothing which you do not mind getting muddy. Long trousers and long sleeved shirts are a good idea as the vegetation in the forests can be spiny and there are some stinging nettles. Travelling shorts and short sleeves are also recommended. The nights can be chilly so a fleece is not a bad idea. Waterproofs, including ponchos, are essential. Comfortable and broken in waterproof walking boots with ankle supports are a must. Insect repellent is needed. Any medication, books or other items of a personal nature is of course up to you to bring along. Oh and please bring plenty of memory cards or film for your camera. Also do not forget sun cream, sun hat and sun glasses as the sun can be very strong here during the day.

Minimum age: 15 years old

dayInfo.description: Entebbe (Uganda) – Arrival – On arrival in Entebbe you will be met by your local guide and taken to your hotel. Here you will be briefed on the tour and told what time you will be collected tomorrow. Today is quite relaxed and allows you time to get a feel for Uganda and the exciting adventure you will be undertaking. We can also visit the botanical gardens on the coast of Lake Victoria or visit the wonderful Uganda Wildlife Authority Education Centre, at both locations wild troops of vervet monkeys and black-and-white colobus live here. (No meal included).

Kibale National Park (Uganda) – Primate Watching– This morning you will be picked up and transferred to Kibale Forest National Park. Kibale Forest is home to the highest concentration of primates in East Africa and is one of the most bio-diverse places in Africa. After lunch you will have a guided walk through the Bigodi Swamp (which is a community based project) and you can expect to see Uganda red colobus, black and white colobus, Uganda managabeys, red-tailed monkeys, L’Hoest monkeys, vervet monkeys, blue monkeys and olive baboons during this walk. We can also look to include a visit to Kihingami Wetland community project too (please enquire about specifically including this). Here spot-necked otters, many primates and birds can be seen, there is also the possibility of spotlighting for Demidoff’s dwarf galago and pottos after dark we you chose to visit Sebitoli forest (Sebitoli is basic accommodation and not included as standard unless requested). (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Kibale National Park (Uganda)– Chimpanzee Tracking – This morning will be a very early start as you will be transferred to Kanyanchu tourist centre inside Kibale National Park. Today you will enjoy one of the most spectacular and amazing wildlife experiences in the world – a full day chimpanzee habituation tour. This tour will give you significantly more time with the wild chimps than most other tours, as we attempt to meet up with the chimps as they de-nest and begin their daily routines (around 05:00-6:00am). The joy of this habituation tour is that we can spend all day with wild chimps and not leave until they create their new nests for the night (about 18:00pm). Spending your first full day in the rainforest is an unforgettable experience and one which will make you eager for more. You will gain first hand experience of how the researchers continue to make ground breaking discoveries of chimp behaviour and by spending the full day here you will get as close to and see as much incredible behaviour of wild chimps than you would anywhere else in the world. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park (Uganda) – Short stops for Game During Transit – This morning you will be taken south past the southern sector of the famous Queen Elizabeth National Park (if local road conditions allow). This area of Kibale Forest National Park is called Ishasha and is famous for its tree-climbing lions. Here you will stop along the way for game that we can see along this road. This wildlife is more typical of the rolling plains of Kenya and Tanzania before continuing on to Bwindi Forest in the afternoon. You will pass by traditional villages and stunning panoramic views of the Virunga Mountains (the area has been called the ‘Switzerland of Africa’ and it is an awe-inspiring landscape. Once you arrive at your lodge, you will have your evening meal in the knowledge that you have arrived in the home of the endangered and impressive mountain gorilla. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Bwindi Impenetrable Forest National Park (Uganda) – Mountain Gorilla Trekking - Today you will have the humbling and awe-inspiring experience of meeting the gentle giants of Bwindi. After an early start you will begin your exciting hike through this beautiful rainforest. The trek will be led by expert local trackers who have spent years finding the forest’s gentle giants and once we find the gorillas you will have around 1 hour in their presence. The length of trek in the park is dependent on a few factors like the weather, trail conditions and how far the gorillas have moved since the previous day. Sometimes it can only take 2 hours and sometimes 8 hours (there and back), but one thing is for sure; when we do see the gorillas at close quarters you will be having one of the greatest experiences anyone can ever have! With only around 700-750 wild mountain gorillas left, it is an incredible experience and one which is helping to pay for their continued protection against poaching and deforestation. Once you return to the accommodation and after your lunch you will have the opportunity to try some of the shorter forest walks with guides and try your luck at finding some of the smaller forest primates. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Volcanoes National Park (Rwanda) – Travelling Day – Early morning you will be picked up and transferred to Volcanoes National Park in Rwanda. As we near the end of the drive, you'll be greeted with the impressive view of the Virunga volcanoes and the vast plain of Rwanda, Uganda and Congo. You will have lunch in the Travellers Rest Hotel; the place which the famous gorilla researcher Dian Fossey called "her second home". After lunch you will continue to the Rwandan border and then your lodge in the shadows of the spectacular Virungas. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Volcanoes National Park (Rwanda) – Mountain Gorilla Tracking – Today you will be once again enjoy some mountain gorilla tracking; but this time you will trekking along the slopes of Virunga Mountains. Many of these gorillas are related to the gorillas studied by Dian Fossey herself. The differences in the gorillas, landscape and habitat here compared to Bwindi is amazing and we fully recommend experiencing both places for gorilla tracking. Depending on how long it takes to track the gorillas, you will be either back at the lodge for a late lunch or dinner. This is the second day you will spend in the presence of mountain gorillas and you may notice differences in their behaviour as the habitats vary slightly between Uganda and Rwanda. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included).

Volcanoes National Park (Rwanda) – Golden Monkey Watching – Today you will be taken from one side of the national park to another, here you will be taken on a guided walk into the thick bamboo thickets in search of the one of the rarest and most beautiful of all African primates. The golden monkey with black limbs, tail tips and crown are endangered and up until 2002 they were only known from one small location in Rwanda. This population (around 200 individuals) has been studied and habituated since 2002, making this the only location where this species can be seen with any regularity. Afterwards you will begin your journey to Nyungwe Forest. As this is a long drive we will spend the night at Lake Kivu before carrying on tomorrow. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included).

Nyungwe Forest National Park – Angolan Colobus Watching – Today you will leave the Lake Kivu and head south towards and the along the shore of the beautiful Lake Kivu before reaching Nyungwe Forest National Park. This park has one of the highest densities of primates in the world and with over 13 species (20% of Africa’s total primates) living here it has to be at the top of the list for primate enthusiasts. On arrival at the forest today you will be taken to find the stunning Angolan colobus monkeys. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included).

Nyungwe Forest National Park – Chimpanzee, Blue Monkey & Wildlife Watching - Today will be your last trip into the forest as you track down a troop of chimpanzees in the morning; during the afternoon you will track down a troop of blue monkeys. There are so many primate species here you will not know where to look as you strain your neck upwards into the tree tops. But it is not just primates which do well here, this forest of one of the most biodiverse in all Africa with 275 species of birds (of which an impressive 25 are endemic), 270 species of trees and shrubs, 100 different orchids and many species of mammals such as elephants, leopards, servals, golden cats, bush pigs and black-fronted duiker. There are loads of walking tracks in the park and the experienced guides will show you the best ones for particular wildlife. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included).

Home – Departure - This morning you will be taken to the Kigali Genocide Memorial Centre before carrying onto the airport (if you have an afternoon flight); Otherwise you will be transferred to the airport so you can catch your return flight home. (Breakfast only)

dayInfo.description: KIGALI/VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK: Upon arrival at Kigali International Airport, you will be met by our Customer Care Representative, outside the airport arrivals section and after a briefing. Enjoy a City Tour of Kigali. (Cost of city tour included) The history of Rwanda dates back centuries, Kigali has been a part of it for 100 years. Founded in 1907 as a German settlement, Kigali did not become the capital until Rwanda’s independence in 1962 when it replaced the colonial seat of power in Butare. Visit the old Kigali and the craft centres then visit the genocide memorial site. Learn about Rwanda’s history from pre-colonial times to the 1994 genocide; learn about other genocides in the world and how this country has dealt with that past. Tour more and see the new developments in Rwanda; the recovery has been incredible, a testament to humankind’s resilience. Lunch in Kigali. Later, depart Kigali and drive to Ruhengeri. 2.5 hrs arriving in the early evening at the Volcanoes National Park.

VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK- GORILLA TREKKING: Early breakfast. 0620 hrs: Transfer to the Volcanoes National Park HQs for your first day of trekking. 0700 hrs: Briefing by your trackers then drive to the trail head for the start of your amazing Gorilla Tracking adventure. Porters may be hired for the trek to carry your backpack and gear. Your trek again starts in the cultivated foothills of the Virunga’s offering stirring views in all directions. When it enters the national park, trekkers will be immersed in the mysterious intimacy of the rainforest, alive with the colorful bird calls, chattering golden monkeys, littered with fresh spoor of the mountains’ elusive buffalo and elephant. Through gaps in the canopy, the magnificent peaks are glimpsed, among the highest in Africa yet easily accessible, beckon an ascent. Weaving through overhanging vines, moss-covered hagenia trees and giant lobelias that thrive in the tropical climate, our experienced trackers, who have spent their entire lives in or close to this forest, soon bring us up close with one of the Gorilla Families. Upon sighting the gorillas, you will stay with them for a magical hour as they go about their daily life, feeding, playing, resting; raising their young. Coming face to face with a giant silverback must truly be one of the greatest wildlife experiences on earth! After the trek, rejoin your driver Guide for a transfer to your lodge for lunch. Afternoon at leisure or visit the twin lakes Ruhondo and Bulera. The north of the park is the most visited area where the perennial Tarangire River meanders across the landscape, while the south consists of a series of vast swamps that transform into verdant plains during the dry season. During your morning game drive, you can expect to see plenty of elephant and lion, the most renowned residents of the park, as well as in excess of 400 species of birds. Admire the rising sun shimmering across the grassy savannahs and the dappled light that filters through the branches of epic baobab trees while large herds of buffalo and zebra graze peacefully on the plains. Check in at your lodge in time for check in and refreshments. Dinner and overnight at your lodge

Enclosed within its towering walls are grasslands, swamps, forests, saltpans, a fresh water lake and a glorious variety of birdlife. Here too are all the members of the ‘Big Five’ (lion, elephant, rhino, leopard and buffalo) as well as a large cast of plains game and one of Africa’s densest populations of predators. Enjoy a picnic lunch on the crater floor before climbing back up and driving to your next lodge in time for relaxation before dinner.
