tourName: Rwanda cultural and gorilla safari
generalInfo:
On this trip, you will experience the beauty of Rwanda – the “land of a thousand Hills.” Enjoy the different backdrops and landscape of Rwanda as you turn along the hilly roads and engage with the people of Rwanda.

You will visit Akagera national park for a time among the Big 5 and other mammals, birds and a time on boat safari. You will also visit the famed mountain gorillas in Volcanoes national park to complete your experience of Rwanda.

The highlight of this Rwandan safari will be interacting with the Rwandan people by visiting their communities and homesteads. You will visit the reconciliation village to learn more about the Rwanda genocide and how this affected people living in this village and how they are coming together to co-exist with the perpetrators of this horrific act.

You will join them as they cook a meal and you will share it. Ask questions to learn more about their daily living. Milk cattle and learn about the various uses of milk.

Safari Highlights:
• Game drive
• Boat ride
• Cultural Experiences
• Gorilla tracking in Volcanoes

dayInfo.description: Arrival to Kigali Welcome to Rwanda the land of “a thousand hills.” Our guide/ representative staff will be at the airport to pick you.

Kigali City Tour & Reconciliation Village. You have an opportunity to visit the genocide reconciliation village and learn about the work there where people are healing from this past through connecting and sharing a village with the perpetrators of genocide. You will visit a home and get involved in preparing a meal. This might be a days trip but in case you depart early you will explore a bit of Kigali.

Transfer to Akagera National park. Today you will have a city tour to sights like the Kigali genocide memorial and the Kandt museum. Have time to interact with folks in Kigali as they go about their everyday life. You will also have time to shop for art and crafts at the different markets and visit a home in Kigali. After this experience, you will leave for Akagera National Park arriving in the park later in the evening for check in to your lodge.

Game drive and Boat Safari in Akagera National Park. Today after breakfast, you will leave for a game drive where you will look out for; Elephants, Hippos, Buffaloes and Leopards. The rare sighting will be Lions and Rhinos that were re- introduced in the park. Return to the lodge for lunch and later take an afternoon boat safari on Lake Ihema for a relaxing time on the waters.

Visit a Rwanda homestead for a cultural experience. Eastern Rwanda is relatively flat compared to other areas in the country and is therefore preferred by the pastoralists. We visit a homestead of cattle keepers and engage in the different activities. We start early morning with the milking cows with hands. The herdsman will guide you on how to soothe the cow and milk it. You also have lessons on how milk is converted traditionally into different products like ghee and yoghurt.

Transfer to Volcanoes national park. After breakfast, we transfer to the volcanoes national park in northern Rwanda after a short game drive on our way out of the park. You will have several photography opportunities as you travel north to the volcanoes.

Gorilla trekking in Volcanoes national park. Have an early breakfast and transfer to the gorilla briefings spot at the park headquarters in Kinigi. After briefing, you are allocated a gorilla group and your driver guide will transfer you to the trail head from which you will start your trek. You are allowed to spend only one hour with them after which you start to trek back.

Gorilla Guardians Village Tour. Today you visit the Gorilla Guardians village formerly known as Iby’Iwacu cultural village for a glimpse into the culture and history of Rwanda. Here you will have a summary of the Rwandan culture over the years. You will also visit a local homestead and participate in making a local meal which you will later enjoy.

Golden Monkey Trekking and End of the Rwanda Cultural Experience Safari. Use the morning to return to the park for golden monkey trekking. Return to the lodge for freshening up and lunch. Then leave for the airport for your flight back home.

tourName: Rwanda express wildlife tour
generalInfo:
Rwanda is known as the land of a thousand hills. This small country has invested and continues to invest in tourism and conservation. They now have the Big 5 in Akagera national park and are steadily increasing the numbers of wildlife in the park. They also continue to see an increase in number of primates especially mountain gorillas and golden monkeys in Volcanoes national park.


On this safari, you will enjoy a game drive experience in Akagera national park. The park is the only Savannah park in Rwanda hosting a number of big mammals with the most sought after being Lions, Buffaloes, Giraffes, Zebras, and Hippos, and recently Rhinos which will provide for great photographic moments. You will also search for animals on a boat safari on Lake Ihema and a night game drive in search of nocturnal animals.


In Volcanoes national park, you will explore the park as you trek mountain gorillas and golden monkeys. In the afternoon, you will visit a cultural experience at the gorilla guardians village.

dayInfo.description: AKAGERA NATIONAL PARK | RELAX ON THE LAKE: We leave for Akagera national park in the morning after your breakfast. The journey to the park is about 2 hours depending on the stopovers along the way. On arrival at the park, we shall proceed to our accommodation check in. Have lunch and then leave for a boat trip on Lake Ihema watch Hippos and crocodiles in the water or by the shores. Return to the lodge and later leave for a night game drive.

AKAGERA NATIONAL PARK | ENCOUNTER WILDLIFE: We arise early and leave after breakfast for a game drive in Akagera national park. We will search of the big mammals like Elephants, Giraffes, Buffaloes, several Antelope species, and recently the re-introduced Lions. The park is a varied habitat for wildlife and a birders haven with over 500 species in the park. The game drive will last about 8 hours or more depending on your interests. After this experience relax at the lodge.

TO VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK | GORILLA GUARDIANS VILLAGE Leave for Volcanoes national park after breakfast, driving through Kigali city. Enjoy the winding roads and scenery of northern Rwanda. In the afternoon, visit the Gorilla Guardians village. Learn about the culture and history of Rwanda. Try out your bow and arrow shooting skills or basketry etc.

GORILLA TREKKING: Start the gorilla trek with a briefing from the ranger guides at the park headquarters. After the brief, join a gorilla group with guidance from your tour guide. Depending on location of gorilla family, you might have to drive to the trail head. After one hour with the gorillas, you start your hike out of the park. Your driver guide will pick you up and transfer you to the lodge for down time.

GOLDEN MONKEY TREKKING & TRANSFER TO KIGALI: Golden monkeys are in the Virunga volcanoes of Uganda, Rwanda and DR Congo. After a short brief from the ranger guide, you will start your hike up in search of the golden monkeys. Enforcement officers join you to help in case you meet buffaloes which can be dangerous. The golden monkeys are more active than the gorillas and you will follow them as they move to feed. Like gorilla trekking, you are only allowed 1 hour with the golden monkey. Have an early lunch and leave for Kigali.

tourName: Rwanda highlights, tailor made tour
placesVisited: Kigali, City tour, Nyungwe Forest National Park, Guided hike and canopy walk, Volcanoes National Park (Virungas), Mountain gorilla trekking, Dian Fossey’s grave, Lake Kivu
generalInfo: Spend nine days discovering the highlights of Rwanda, from beautiful Lake Kivu to gorilla trekking in the mountains, on this tailor made tour. Spend some time in the capital Kigali, where a guided tour will reveal Rwanda’s colonial past and its recent traumatic history, with a visit to the genocide memorial site at Gisozi, just outside the city, an emotional highlight. You’ll also explore the dense rainforest of Nyungwe Forest National Park with a local guide, home to abundant wildlife, birds and giant plants, and then move on to Virungas National Park where you can choose to take one or two treks to see the mountain gorillas that live here. The tour ends with time relaxing on the shores of lovely Lake Kivu.

dayInfo.description: On arrival at the Kigali International Airport you will be met and transferred to the Kigali Serena Hotel in the heart of Kigali city. Overnight at the hotel on bed and breakfast basis (Dinner is on own arrangement)

After breakfast, embark on a City Tour of Kigali. Learn the history behind Rwanda through the tales told by its capital; get acquainted with pre-colonial and colonial Rwanda, the 1994 genocide and see the new developments. A visit to the genocide memorial site at Gisozi, about 10-15 minutes outside the city centre, is the highlight of the city tour. This visit is an emotional experience for most visitors as they encounter the horrid massacre that engulfed the country in 1994. It also presents an opportunity to learn about other genocides in the world. You then have lunch at a local restaurant in Kigali After lunch, depart Kigali on a scenic towards Nyumgwe, stopping at the Kings Palace and Butare Musuem en-route. You arrive at Nyungwe Top View Lodge for dinner and overnight.

Today, we depart Nyungwe and travel by road to Volcanoes National Park (Virungas) to the Ruhengeri district, where we based up for two nights to enjoy Mountain Gorilla Trekking. Overnight Mountain Gorilla View Lodge,

After an early breakfast at the lodge, transfer to the Volcanoes National Park at 0630. Arrive at the park headquarters for registration - a simple process where the park staff asses your fitness level to determine which Gorilla Family you will visit. Thereafter, the park staff brief on trekking times and conditions to the various groups based upon their location in the park the previous evening. There are a total of 80 gorilla permits available each day with a maximum of 8 trekkers visiting any one group. Treks vary in duration depending on which gorilla group you are assigned to. After locating your assigned gorilla group, you will spend approximately one hour in their company before heading back down the volcano slopes. The park is located in the Virunga Mountains, a magnificent chain of dormant volcanoes in the north of Rwanda which it shares with the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and Uganda. The mountains form part of the extension of the Congo-Nile divide, separating two of Africa´s most important watersheds. They are also home to the world’s last surviving Mountain Gorilla populations, currently about 700 individuals. Overnight Mountain Gorilla View Lodge.
Optional second trek or visit to Dian Fossey’s grave. Overnight Mountain Gorilla View Lodge
Depart to Lake Kivu, to enjoy some tranquillity on the lake shore. Overnight Lake Kivu Serena Hotel.
Drive back to Kigali in time for your flight home.

tourName: Rwanda highlights tour
placesVisited: Kigali, optional: guided tour or visit to local markets, Nyungwe Forest, chimpanzee trekking, Lake Kivu, Volcanoes National Park, gorilla tracking, Kigali Genocide Memorial and Education Centre
generalInfo:
Track chimpanzees, monkeys and baboons in Nyungwe National Park; travel deep into the forests of Parc National des Volcans in search of mountain gorillas; explore Kigali, the vibrant capital of Rwanda; then relax on the shores of Lake Kivu.

This week-long adventure in Rwanda includes the highlights of this fascinating country, from once-in-a-lifetime wildlife encounters to lakeside relaxation, immersed in natural beauty. You'll arrive into Kigali, then transfer to Nyungwe National Park, where you will get the chance to track chimpanzees, spot monkeys and baboons and walk across a canopy walkway. Hiking deep into the forests of Parc National des Volcans, you'll trek to encounter families of endangered mountain gorillas in their natural habitats. After jungle adventures, you'll relax on the stunning, palm-fringed shores of Lake Kivu. Return to Kigali to explore colourful markets, learn about the devastating Rwandan genocide at the Kigali Genocide Memorial Centre (a difficult, but poignant place to visit) and discover life in a modern East African city.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Kigali - Our representatives will meet you upon arrival in Kigali and transfer you to your hotel. Explore the vibrant capital of Rwanda this afternoon with your guide. Visit bustling local markets and the Caplaki Craft Village to see craftsmen selling handicrafts in wooden huts.

Transfer to Nyungwe Forest - Enjoy driving through Rwandan countryside to Nyungwe Forest National Park, located in Rwanda’s mountainous southwest, near the border with Burundi. This scenic journey takes approximately five hours. You have the option to visit the King’s Palace Museum at Nyanza and the Ethnographic Museum of Rwanda (Rwanda National Museum) in Butare. You will be taken to your next accommodation where you will stay 2 nights.

Tracking Chimpanzees in Nyungwe Forest National Park - Join a guided hike through the dense forest of Nyungwe Forest National Park in search of chimpanzees. This is a phenomenal wildlife experience on par with gorilla trekking, although it is lesser known. During your time in Nyungwe Forest National Park, you’ll also have an opportunity to walk across the canopy walkway: a 200-metre bridge suspended between giant trees, 50 metres above the forest floor. The walkway offers incredible views of the forest's upper canopies and is a great opportunity to spot wildlife and birds.

Transfer to Lake Kivu - Leave Nyungwe and head for your next destination, the sandy shores of Lake Kivu. Upon arrival, you are free to enjoy the beauty of the lake, relax on the shore and take part in optional water-based activities such as stand-up paddle boarding, water-skiing, jetskiing and windsurfing. You might also want to visit the nearby coffee plantations, hike through banana groves, rainforest and woodlands, cycle though lush green hills or visit local communities to gain an insight into the rural life and Rwandan culture. You will be taken to your luxury accommodation for 1 night.

Transfer to Parc National des Volcans - After breakfast, you’ll be driven from Lake Kivu to Parc National des Volcans (Volcanoes National Park). On arrival at your accommodation, you’ll be briefed about tomorrow’s gorilla trek.

Track Gorillas in Parc National des Volcans - Drive to Kinigi, located in the foothills of Virungas in Parc National des Volcans, after breakfast. Your guide and tracker will lead you deep into the forest in search of your allocated gorilla family. This trip might last anywhere between 30 minutes to eight hours depending upon the exact location of the specific gorilla family you’re tracking. Spend up to one hour quietly observing the gorilla family. The gorillas are likely to be just a few metres away from you and they will continue to go about with their daily lives, feeding and interacting with each other under the watchful gaze of the silverback. Transfer back to your accommodation late in the afternoon and you are free for the remainder of the day.

Depart from Kigali - We will drive you to Kigali in the morning. Visit the Kigali Genocide Memorial, which commemorates the 1994 genocide against the Tutsi, and learn more about this painful episode in Rwandan history. You will then be transferred to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Rwanda hike, bike & kayak holiday
generalInfo:
Rwanda, known as the “Land of a Thousand Hills,” is a jewel in the heart of Africa, renowned for its stunning landscapes, rich biodiversity, and warm hospitality. One of the country’s highlights is kayaking on the tranquil waters of Lake Kivu, an expansive inland sea framed by lush, rolling mountains. The lake’s serene atmosphere and panoramic views make it a perfect spot for relaxation and adventure alike.

Talk to Rwandans about the communities they live in and experience how a nation has come from a place of darkness and genocide to embrace and thrive in tourism.

Beyond its natural beauty, Rwanda captivates with its vibrant culture and unique activities. Canoeing down the Mukungwa River immerses you in peaceful rural landscapes, passing picturesque villages and valleys that offer a glimpse into everyday life. In the bustling markets, you’ll be greeted by a riot of colors, aromas, and flavors as you explore stalls filled with spices, tropical fruits, and handcrafted treasures. For wildlife enthusiasts, few experiences rival trekking to see Rwanda’s iconic mountain gorillas in Volcanoes National Park. This once-in-a-lifetime encounter with these majestic creatures is as moving as it is exhilarating. Chimpanzee tracking in the dense rainforests adds another layer of excitement, offering close encounters with some of our closest relatives in the animal kingdom. Rwanda’s blend of adventure, culture, and natural wonder creates memories that will last a lifetime.

dayInfo.description: Kigali On arrival at Kigali International Airport your guide will pick you up and transfer you to your hotel Heaven Boutique Hotel is a popular four star hotel with 30 rooms located on two separate properties in a peaceful, residential area of Kigali. Heaven Boutique Hotel features local Rwandan décor, warm hospitality, delicious breakfasts at Heaven Restaurant, and access to a solar-heated salt water swimming pool, outdoor yoga deck and fitness center.

Umusambi Village is a beautifully restored wetland area, operated by the Rwanda Wildlife Conservation Association. .As well as the Grey Crowned Cranes, this 21-hectare nature reserve is a peaceful haven for visitors to enjoy the walking trails and be at one with nature, while also learning about our conservation work and the importance of protecting our natural environments. The Kigali Genocide Memorial is a place of remembrance & learning where you will have time to reflect on a tragic time in Rwanda’s past. As you walk around the memorial and think about and remember the victims, 250,000 of whom have their final resting place here, you will be moved by the shocking events that led up to and took place during the genocide

Set on top of a hill within the Nyungwe Forest National Park, Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel boasts panoramic views of the surrounding mountains. Each room at Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel has a seating area equipped with a TV, and some rooms have satellite channels. They all have a balcony offering mountain views and a private bathroom fitted with a shower-over-bath combo. Slippers and free toiletries are provided for your convenience. Guests can enjoy a meal at the on-site restaurant or relax with a drink at the bar. Barbecue facilities are also available. Nyungwe has a 24-hour front desk and arrange shuttle services on request. Using Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel as your peaceful retreat to return to, head out to the forest in search of chimpanzees and colobus monkeys, explore scenic nature trails or visit to a nearby waterfall. Overnight Top View Hotel (or similar).

Spend an amazing hour watching a troop of wild chimpanzees in the forest! Setting off very early at 5am, you will transfer to a section of Nyungwe Forest known as Cyamudongo, where most of Rwanda’s habituated chimpanzees are located. Here you’ll meet your local ranger a small visitor centre, and then as soon as the trackers locate the family of chimpanzees – that number about 40 individuals – you’ll be off, trekking along the paths but also possibly, scaling short sections of the steep rainforest slopes immersed in the forest. Listen carefully and you may hear the chimps before you see them literally swinging from the trees or possibly running around on the ground all around you Accessible from the Uwinka Visitor Centre a Forest Ranger will lead your walk through the forest. With an eye for some of the 310 bird species, butterflies, orchids, centuries-old trees and 75 mammals including 13 primates that live here this walk is a spectacular journey in the largest surviving example of an Afro Montane ecosystem and one of the oldest continuously forested locations on Earth. The walk includes a 200m long canopy walkway that takes you high above the forest floor providing a unique platform for observing the forest. Overnight Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel

Beginning at Nyungwe Forest Lodge, the first half of this hike winds through brilliant green tea fields As you start to climb higher into the forest, enjoy the gorgeous views northwest to Lake Kivu and the Democratic Republic of Congo. At 2.3 km the trail descends into one of the most densely vegetated and steepest rainforest ravines on any trail at Nyungwe. Cool misty air and the murmur of a river rise from below, mingled with calls of birds, tree frogs and insects. Ferns, mosses,lichens and flowers are exceptionally abundant in the high humidity.Several species of primates are commonly found here, as well as many birds. You may enjoy the sighting of the waterfall from two main vantage points depending upon how wet you want to get. The first is at the end of a short spur, which leads to a picnic bench overlooking the fall at 50 meters distance. Small trees partially obscure the view. The falls can be reached by descending to the wild river below and then clambering over wet rocks to a large boulder in the middle of the amphitheatre. From here, you’ll be close to the bottom of the falls, where it thunders down.

Come on a journey to discover Lake Kivu’s spectacular ‘Bay of Islands’. Paddling through the deep azure waters we island hop past uninhabited islands – including Napoleon island with its famous bat colony. We spend the night camping on another beautiful, uninhabited island, which is still mostly covered with natural woodland and so teams with birdlife. We return to Kibuye, via the coast and call into Amohoro Island for lunch. Day 1: Setting off from Kibuye, we soon approach Lake Kivu’s ‘Bay of Islands’ a beautiful setting unlike anywhere else in the country. We then ‘island hop’, stop off for lunch and a swim in the crystal clear and impressively clean, fresh water to cool off. In the afternoon, we visit Napoleon Island where there is a remarkable (and noisy) colony of thousands of fruit bats that fight amongst themselves for the best roost. It’s then just a short paddle to our campsite, on another beautiful uninhabited island that is still covered with native trees that provide a rare haven for numerous species.

Day 2: After a simple breakfast, we turn back towards Kibuye or end in Kinunu for a coffee tour before meeting your driver to proceed to your next destination, this time following the coast where we have superb views of the lush mosaic of crops on small farms that make Rwanda’s hills so special. Before reaching Kibuye, we call in for lunch on Amohoro (Peace) Island, where there will be time to contemplate just how special the past couple of days have been. Then, in the afternoon it’s just a short paddle back to where we began; was it only yesterday?

With a quality hard-tail mountain bike or e-bike, helmet and cycling gloves provided, you'll explore the Rwandan countryside on the many small tracks and trails that criss-cross the landscape. The twin lakes of Ruhondo and Burera are two lakes separated by 1km strip of land and produced by volcanic eruptions. This cycle will give you an opportunity to view all the 5 Rwanda volcanoes, this depends on the weather condition. This is a great way to explore the outskirts of Volcanoes. We visit the Ellen DeGeneres Campus of the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund is to see gorilla conservation in action. Building on Dian Fossey's pioneering work, now that gorilla populations of the Virunga Volcanoes are slowly increasing and their habitats are being protected, this centre is a highly recommended, remarkable place to visit. Mountain gorillas have been monitored and studied closely since Dian Fossey began her work with them in 1967, after establishing the Karisoke Research Center. She started the process of habituating them to the presence of human observers so that she could closely observe and document their behaviors, status, movements and other important information. Today, the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund trackers and researchers protect and study roughly half of all the mountain gorillas in Rwanda, with the other half protected by the Rwandan national park authorities. Tiloreza Volcanoes Ecolodge

An early start to an epic day! Take a short drive to Kinigi, which is 12km away and where the Volcanoes National Park headquarters is located, you need to be there by 7am or you risk invalidating your precious permits! You will meet your park guide who will take time to explain where you will be trekking, which gorilla group you have been assigned, and the guidelines you needed to follow when in the mountain gorilla’s presence. Around 8am you will start the trek through the fields towards the park. The trek in the park is at elevations of 2500-3000m, so at times breathing can become a conscious effort as you move through the thick vegetation towards the gorillas. Excitement mounts as you approach the group. Your guide will reassure and calmed the gorillas with deep grunts, and you will be encouraged to do the same. Spending time in the mountain gorilla’s presence is truly incredible. After your trek you will return to the park headquarters. You will then enjoy lunch nearby before making the return journey to Kigali. The drive is approximately 2 hours. Overnight Heaven Boutique (or similar).
Today its time to say goodbye to your guide, they will transfer you to Kigali airport in time for your flight home.

tourName: Rwanda kayaking holiday and gorilla safari
generalInfo: Rwanda is known as the “land of a thousand hills” and lies in the heart of Africa. You’ll see this amazing country whilst kayaking on Lake Kivu, a beautiful mountain ringed inland sea. Experience the heart of Rwanda as you walk through the canopy of the rain forest, taste and smell the spices from the colourful markets, canoe down the Mukingwa River and track chimpanzees and the impressive mountain gorillas.

dayInfo.description: Kigali (B,L,D) On arrival in Kigali you will be met at the airport by your guide and transferred to your hotel where you will check in, freshen up and have breakfast. On a morning walking city tour of Kigali you can familiarize yourself with the area. Your tour includes a visit to the market where you can sample local produce and there’s also the opportunity to relax in a local milk bar, the Rwandan equivalent to a coffee shop! In the afternoon you can visit the Genocide Memorial Museum. While this is a tough experience it provides an opportunity to both understand the history of this tragic event and also to pay your respects at the memorial. Furthermore it outlines the current efforts being made to create a brighter future for all Rwandans. Or there is a possible alternative to tour an art gallery. Please note that the walking tour is not available during Umuganda which is a community day on the last Saturday morning of each month. Overnight Heaven Boutique Hotel (or similar).

Kigali – Nyungwe National Park – Gisakura (B, L, D). This morning start the drive towards Nyungwe National Park. This park is a beautifully preserved forest that covers an area of over 1000sq km. It is home to over 300 bird species, many butterflies, orchids, and 75 mammal species including 13 primates. In the afternoon walk the Canopy Trail in Nyungwe National Park, or with your personal input your guide can arrange a hike that is right for you. The Canopy Trail is approximately 2 hours, trekking through the forest and includes the “canopy walk”. This refers to a foot bridge located 50m above the forest, and around 90m long. Not for the faint hearted but worth it for the views! Overnight at Top View Hotel (or similar).

Gisakura – Cyamudongo Forest – Lake Kivu (B, L, D). There’s an early start this morning for the transfer to Cyamudongo Forest for an amazing chimpanzee tracking experience. The reserve is located approximately an 1½ hours away and on arrival you will meet up with your tracker and head out into the forest to spend an hour observing chimpanzees. As our closest living relative chimpanzees share 98.7% DNA, and it’s an exhilarating experience to observe them in the wild. Chimpanzees communicate with pant hoots, screams, and by hitting the tree buttress so you may hear them before you actually see them! The length of the walk and the time taken to find the group will vary, so prepare for a long walk through the forest. The chimpanzees can be seen as they move through the tree canopy, or as they travel along the forest floor. The afternoon can be spent at leisure or you can take a guided walk through the villages surrounding your lodge. Overnight Kivu Lodge (or similar).

Lake Kivu (B, L, D). This morning you will be briefed on kayaking guidelines and safety procedures before heading out on the lake in your kayak. Lake Kivu is Rwanda’s largest lake and it naturally has no hippos or crocodiles, making it a safe area for kayaking. It is surrounded by hills with very little obvious development. After a couple of hours of leisurely kayaking you will be provided with a picnic lunch. Continue along the coast to Kibuye and enjoy dinner at your lodge. Please note that all of your luggage will be transferred by the support boat. Overnight Rwiza Village Lodge (or similar).

Kibuye – Lake Kivu, Bishaya Island (B, L, D). Spend the morning kayaking through Rwanda’s bay of islands. Enjoy a picnic lunch at Munini, popularly known as Napoleon Island, where you might to see a colony of thousands of fruit bats. Continue kayaking on to another small uninhabited island where the crew of your support boat will have already set up your tents in preparation for your night camping. They will also prepare your evening meal whilst you relax on the lakeshore. In the afternoon you may get the chance to kayak with singing fisherman (subject to weather and fisherman’s timetable; there is no fishing in September and October). Overnight camp on uninhabited island (Bishayu Island).

Lake Kivu – Cyimbili (B, L, D). This morning set out in your kayak to explore a lovely section of the coast where many locals take to the water in dug out canoes and wooden boats. Enjoy a picnic lunch and then kayak on towards Cyimbili. Please note that the support boat is available if required as an alternative to kayaking. In the afternoon take a coffee tour of the local plantation and learn about their production methods. Enjoy the evening their guesthouse. Overnight at Cyimbili Guesthouse (or similar).

Cyimbili – Gisenyi (B, L, D). This morning experience the conclusion of yesterdays coffee tour; the roasting and drinking! Then continue kayaking along Lake Kivu where on your route you can see a fish farm and hot springs. Arrive at your hotel for lunch. Spend the afternoon relaxing in the grounds of Paradis Malahide Hotel which is situated by the lake, and watch the singing fishermen go out at sunset. The fishermen spend the night on the water, their 3 vessels are linked together with poles and nets to catch the fish, and hearing them singing as they paddled out for the night is a surprisingly moving experience. Overnight Paradis Malahide Hotel (or similar)

Gisenyi – Musanze (B, L, D). This morning travel by road to Musanze, approximately a 2 hour drive. Musanze is the third largest town in Rwanda and as the closest town to the Volcanoes National Park so it’s a convenient base from which to track the mountain gorillas. The town is set at a fairly high altitude (1850m) and as you get closer to the park you will see a horizontal line along the volcanoes which distinguishes where the farm land ends and the forests of the park begin. After lunch it’s time for your canoe trip on the Mukungwa River. The Sunday Times has described this trip as a “half day of pure joy”. Following the safety briefing you’ll climb into your canoes and head down to the river. The river banks are abundant with birds, over 40 species have been recorded, and it’s a great way to observe the countryside and see Rwanda from a different perspective. Overnight La Locanda (or similar)

Musanze – Volcanoes National Park – Kigali (B, L, D). An early start to an epic day! Take a short drive to Kinigi, which is 12km away and where the Volcanoes National Park headquarters is located, you need to be there by 7am or you risk invalidating your precious permits! You will meet your park guide who will take time to explain where you will be trekking, which gorilla group you have been assigned, and the guidelines you needed to follow when in the mountain gorilla’s presence. Around 8am you will start the trek through the fields towards the park. The trek in the park is at elevations of 2500-3000m, so at times breathing can become a conscious effort as you move through the thick vegetation towards the gorillas. Excitement mounts as you approach the group. Your guide will reassure and calmed the gorillas with deep grunts, and you will be encouraged to do the same. Spending time in the mountain gorilla’s presence is truly incredible. After your trek you will return to the park headquarters. You will then enjoy lunch nearby before making the return journey to Kigali. The drive is approximately 2 hours. Overnight Heaven Boutique (or similar)
Kigali (B). Today its time to say goodbye to your guide, they will transfer you to Kigali airport in time for your flight home..

tourName: Rwanda luxury gorilla safari
generalInfo:
This 4 days Luxury Rwanda Gorilla Trekking safari will take you for gorilla trekking of Mountain Gorillas in Volcanoes National park in Rwanda, the ‘’land of a thousand hills’’
Gorilla trekking in Rwanda is one of the highlight safari experiences in Africa. You will come face to face with one of the habituated gorilla families, staying in one of the best luxury lodges in Rwanda- Virunga Lodge

Highlights
Gorilla Trekking
Iby'lwacu Cultural Village
Kigali City Tour
Beautiful landscapes

dayInfo.description: Pick up from Kigali airport – Transfer to Kigali Serena Today upon your arrival at Kigali international airport, you will be warmly welcomed by a representative and transferred by road to your hotel. You will relax at the hotel for the rest of the time Journey time: 10 minutes Meal Plan: Not inclusive Accommodation: Kigali Serena

Kigali City Tour - Transfer to Volcanoes National Park Today after breakfast, you will go for a guided city tour of Kigali, one of the safest and cleanest capital cities in Africa. The tour will start from the first modern building that the city was founded on, learning about the country’s history from the pre-colonial times to the 1994 genocide. You will visit Kigali’s historical genocide memorial centre. After the city tour, you will begin the journey north wards to Volcanoes National Park. You will get to your lodge in time for lunch Journey Time: 3 hours Accommodation: Virunga Lodge Meal Plan: All food

Gorilla Trekking - Visit Iby'lwachu Cultural Village Today after breakfast, your guide will transfer you to Volcanoes National Park head quarters for to start your gorilla trek. You will be briefed by trackers and after the briefing, you will be driven to the trail to start your gorilla trekking adventure experience. You will trek through foothills of the Virunga, offering great views in all angles. Upon seeing where the mountain gorillas are, you will stay with them for an hour as they go about their day to day life, playing, feeding, touching among others. Coming face to face with these endangered mountain gorillas is an experience you will never forget. Ps: We highly recommend that you hire services of a porter who carries your back pack during gorilla trekking. It costs 15 US dollars per porter After gorilla tracking, your driver will transfer you back to the lodge for lunch In the afternoon after lunch, you will visit Iby’Iwachu Cultural Village. Iby’lwacu cultural village gives tourists a rare chance to meet and interact with local people in their environment offering an experience of Rwandese culture and traditions The village is located near Volcanoes National park and it was started to showcase local and traditional activities, lifestyle and art craft among other. The village was started by the local people for the communities who benefit and earn directly from this great community based tourism initiative so as to improve their social economic wellbeing and as an in incentive to conserve the mountain gorillas and their home Accommodation: Virunga Lodge Meal Plan: All meals
Departure- Today after breakfast, you will be transferred back to Kigali international airport for your onward journey

tourName: Rwanda primate holiday, 6 days
placesVisited: Short but adventure-packed Rwanda safari, Track chimpanzees and colobus monkeys in the forest, Enjoy life among the treetops with a Nyungwe Forest canopy walk, Spend a memorable hour in the company of gentle mountain gorillas, Moving visit to the Rwanda Genocide Memorial in Kigali, Services of an expert local naturalist guide throughout, Gain cultural insights through a number of community encounters, Park fees and community visits directly contribute to conservation efforts
generalInfo:
Ideal for travellers with little time, but who don’t want to compromise on their wildlife experiences, this Rwanda primate safari offers an unforgettable encounter with man’s closest cousins, the mountain gorillas of Volcanoes National Park. And, before your six days are up, you’ll also trek into the Nyungwe Forest in search of cheeky, chattering chimpanzees, and see a host of monkey species including colobus, golden and L’Hoest’s monkeys as they play among the trees.

Begin in Kigali, the Rwandan capital, with a moving visit to the Genocide Memorial, marking the genocide of 1994 when up to 800,000 Tutsi people were murdered by armed Hutu militias. You’ll also visit craft markets, and have time to explore the city a little to see how its youthful population has come together in reconciliation – not least through civic pride.

From the capital you’ll embark on the 200km (five hour) drive to Nyungwe Forest National Park. On arrival, you’ll get an atmospheric introduction to the forest as you head up on a canopy walk, to learn about life among the treetops. It’s an entirely different experience to walking along trails on the ground, with different species present, and amazing views. There are some 13 primate species in Nyungwe Forest, along with 300-odd bird species, and many colourful butterflies. The biodiversity on display is spectacular meaning that your nature hikes, led by expert local guides, are bound to reveal some wonderful sights. A second day in Nyungwe Forest will be spent trekking in search of a habituated chimpanzee group to watch as they eat, play and groom themselves. You’ll have just an hour with the troop to minimise disruption on their lives, which is plenty for them but sadly never enough for visitors!

Another long journey awaits after your chimpanzee trekking as you make for your final stop: Volcanoes National Park. Here you’ll spend an hour with a family of mountain gorillas. Their calm demeanour belies their immense size and strength, and this will likely prove one of the most unforgettable travel experiences you’ll ever have. Trekking out to find the gorillas can be challenging due to the terrain and the fact they move around constantly, so it can take an hour to find them, or much longer. But you can travel with porters, and if you’re relatively fit you shouldn’t have too much trouble.

Finally, as you head back to Kigali, you’ll stop off for a visit to a ‘gorilla guardians village’ – a great way to understand the effort that goes into protecting these incredible animals, and find out how your holiday has contributed to their ongoing survival.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Kigali. Depending on the time you arrive in Kigali, your naturalist guide will pick you up and you start your safari with a short Kigali city tour to visit the Genocide memorial, and craft markets.

Depart for Nyungwe national park in southern Rwanda. This morning we depart for Nyungwe forest in southern Rwanda. Have a stopover at ethnographic museum of Rwanda, here we will learn about the culture and history of the Rwandan people. Proceed to your lodge for check in.

Chimpanzee tracking in Nyungwe forest & Canopy Walk. After an early breakfast, we leave for Chimpanzee tracking in Nyungwe forest. In the afternoon you shall go for the canopy walk which lasts approximately 2 hours after which you return to your hotel.

Colobus monkey trekking and transfer to Volcanoes national park. This morning, we leave for the briefing point at the Nyungwe forest. After briefing, the ranger guide will lead you into the forest for the Colobus monkey trekking. You are allowed 1 hour in their presence before you start the trek back. After this experience, leave for Volcanoes national park with views of Lake Kivu and winding roads in the land of a thousand hills. Visit the Imbabazi Museum - a former orphanage, learn about the transformation work they are doing. We arrive at the hotel later that evening.

Gorilla trekking and Gorilla Guardians Village. Meet the mountain gorillas in the dense jungles of the Virunga ranges. generalInfo:

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Rwanda the “land of a thousand hills.” Our guide/ representative staff will be at the airport to pick you and transfer you to the hotel for check in and overnight.

TO VOLCANOES NATIONAL PARK. Have breakfast and then leave for Volcanoes national park. Start with canoeing river Mukungwa – enjoy Rwandan stories from your guide as you watch birds in the agricultural lands and wetlands along the river. Have lunch and check in to your lodge.

RWANDA GORILLA TREKKING. Start the gorilla trek with a briefing from the ranger guides at the park headquarters. After the brief, join a gorilla group with guidance from your tour guide. tourName: Rwanda primates & Mafia Island holiday
placesVisited: Kigali, Volcanoes National Park, Dar es Salaam, Mafia Island, gorilla & golden monkey tracking
generalInfo:
Mountain gorillas, monkeys and whale sharks are the stars of this wildlife holiday in Rwanda and Tanzania. Things start off full speed ahead as you crack on with tracking wild mountain gorillas and endangered golden monkeys in their natural habitat in Volcanoes National Park. Following in the footsteps of an expert guide, you might be lucky enough to spy a silverback this deep into the Virunga Mountains. The rainforest lodge you stay in is both luxury and socially responsible, supporting projects that reduce human-animal conflict.

The wildlife tracking is balanced with total relaxation on Mafia Island – a remote island off the coast of Tanzania. It plonks itself in Mafia Island Marine Park, so the only activity you need do is snorkelling in Chole Bay... keeping your eyes peeled for gentle whale sharks and humpbacks.

You’ll travel with a holiday company that’s an expert at crafting tailor made luxury trips. They know that well-managed tourism has helped save the last of the mountain gorillas in Rwanda, so they’ll acquire permits, match you up with an expert guide, and make sure you’re informed on all the dos and don’ts of trekking in vulnerable rainforest. They’ll also suggest the best seasons to see whale sharks and humpbacks in the little-visited Mafia Islands, and give you a code of conduct for snorkelling alongside these curious mammals.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Kigali - Upon arrival in Kigali, Rwanda's capital, you'll be met by a representative and transferred to your hotel. In the afternoon, you can explore this vibrant city with a guide. After your city tour, you’ll be transferred to Kinigi at the foothills of the Virungas in Parc National des Volcans.

Gorilla Tracking in Volcanoes National Park - After an early breakfast, you’ll drive to the Parc National des Volcans, where you’ll meet your guide and be briefed you about your trek and the various aspects of "gorilla etiquette." Your professional guide will lead you into the forest in search of your allocated gorilla family. The high altitude and steep, slippery trails, plus the humidity under the forest canopy, can make the trek challenging, but it’s definitely worth the effort to spend time with wild mountain gorillas in their natural habitat.

Golden Monkey Tracking in Volcanoes National Park - After another early breakfast, you’ll once again be driven to the Parc National des Volcans, where you’ll meet your guide and be briefed about your golden monkey trek. Tracking golden monkeys and gorillas is a similar experience – you’ll be in a small group of no more than eight people and you can spend an hour with the monkeys in their natural habitats. However, as the golden monkeys live in the bamboo vegetation at the base of the volcanoes, the trek is not as strenuous as tracking gorillas. The monkeys are very active and it is likely that you’ll find them leaping between the bamboo branches in the trees above you or playing on the forest floor. After your golden monkey trek, you can also visit the Iby’Iwacu cultural village before returning to your accommodation.

Fly to Dar es Salaam - After breakfast, you’ll be transferred to Kigali Airport for your flight to Dar es Salaam in Tanzania. Upon arriva, you’ll be transferred to your beachfront accommodation in Dar es Salaam and you’ll have the rest of the afternoon and evening free to explore this fascinating city.

Fly to Mafia Island - After breakfast, you’ll be picked up and transferred to the domestic airport for your flight to Mafia Island. On arrival in Kilindoni, you’ll be met by a driver and taken to your chosen accommodation, where you’ll spend the next five nights on a half-board basis.

Explore Mafia Island - Enjoy Mafia Island at your leisure. You can dive or snorkel in Mafia Island Marine Park (the largest marine protected area in the Indian Ocean); try windsurfing, kayaking or stand up paddle boarding. If you’re visiting Mafia Island between October and March you’ll have the opportunity to snorkel with Whale Sharks, or if you’re visiting between July and October you may be lucky enough to see Humpback Whales. If you’re visiting from June to September you can join a turtle-hatching trip and witness hundreds of baby turtles scramble from the sandy beaches to the warm waters of the Indian Ocean. You may wish to stroll through Chole village where you can visit the old mosque, the Fruit Bat sanctuary or the boat yard or you may wish to explore Mrora Forest, Ras Mbizi Coconut Plantation or the Lighthouse at Ras Mkumbi.

Return to Dar es Salaam - Today, you’ll be driven back to Kilondoni Airport for your return flight to Dar es Salaam. A driver will meet you at the domestic airport to transfer you to the international airport for your flight home.

tourName: Rwanda primates & national parks adventure
generalInfo:
ENCOUNTER endangered mountain gorillas in their natural habitat — the largest living primates on the planet.

EXPLORE the clean, progressive city of Kigali. Visit the Genocide Memorial and a non-profit organization that offers vocational training to local women.

VISIT one of Africa’s oldest rainforests, Nyungwe Forest National Park, and embark on a breathtaking canopy walk with stunning views and the chance to see wildlife like colobus monkeys and tropical birds.

EMBARK on two incredible primate treks to see playful golden monkeys in Volcanoes National Park and chimpanzees in Nyungwe Forest National Park.

KAYAK on the tranquil waters of Lake Kivu, enjoying the scenic views of Rwanda’s Bay of Islands and the diverse birdlife that thrives along the shoreline.

LEARN how yarn is processed from sheep to product through traditional craftsmanship at a vocational organization for local women.

JOIN in a Rwandan cooking class and eat the lunch we make with locals.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Kigali International Airport, a driver/guide will transfer you to Heaven Boutique Hotel. After check-in you’re free to relax in the room, by the pool or in the restaurant. In the evening, enjoy a meet and greet dinner with your fellow travelers to kick off the adventure ahead! Dinner Included.

Following an early breakfast at the hotel, we head to Nyamirambo Women's Centre, a non-profit that empowers local women with access to education and vocational training. Participate in a traditional Rwandan cooking class with one of the local women, embark on a guided city walk of the nearby area while your meal is cooking, and return to enjoy the lunch you’ve prepared. Afterwards, visit the Genocide Memorial, where we make a donation in support of remembrance and learning. This self-guided audio tour is a deeply moving and somber reflection of Rwanda’s history and the resilience of its people. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

The day begins with an early flight to Rusizi. After, we’ll begin our journey to Nyungwe Forest National Park, one of Africa’s oldest rainforests and home to over 1,000 plant species, 322 bird species, and 75 known mammal species. Upon arrival, embark on a breathtaking canopy walk on safe suspension bridges connected by the forest’s lush trees. The walk offers incredible views of Lake Kivu, and different sections of the Nyungwe Forest. During the walk, look out for the diverse animals, birds, amphibians, and reptiles that inhabit this wildlife paradise. Then, we’ll make our way towards the stunning Ndambarare Waterfall. If you’re lucky, you may spot L’Hoests monkeys, Colobus monkeys, and other primates along the trail! Immerse yourself in the tranquil sounds of the waterfall’s cascading water, surrounded by vibrant greenery — the perfect place to connect to nature’s serenity. Afterwards, we will settle in at Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel, where we’ll be staying for the next two nights. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

Following an early breakfast, we’ll drive to Nyungwe Forest National Park, notable for having 13 types of primates, and meet our guides for the day. Following an orientation, we’ll head out for the remarkable experience of chimpanzee trekking. The trekking can be strenuous, so being capable of walking on uneven ground in hot and humid conditions is a must. Local porters are available to carry your backpack and assist you throughout the walk. Viewing is kept to about an hour, so look forward to an up-close look at these wonderful chimpanzees in their natural habitat! Observe key moments of their daily lives, from dashing through the foliage and playing with their fellow chimps to resting among the leaves and feeding on a variety of plants. After, we return to the hotel for dinner and a restful evening. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

After breakfast, we’ll drive to Kibuye and visit Kinunu Coffee Plantation, a local farm on the shore of Lake Kivu. Learn about the journey of coffee from harvesting beans, to roasting, and finally to the cup from local farmers who share their techniques. This visit offers an immersive experience into this intricate process, deepening your appreciation for Rwandan coffee and highlighting the dedication of the local farmers who cultivate it. In the afternoon, enjoy a kayaking excursion on Lake Kivu. Paddle past the shorelines and Rwanda’s Bay of Islands, towards Napoleon Island which is known for its colony of fruit bats and incredible views of the lake. Depending on the fitness level and interest of your group, you may decide to stop at Napoleon Island for a hike to the summit of Napoleon Island or continue your kayaking journey. This excursion typically lasts between two to four hours, with duration varying based on group preferences. On the journey back, soak in the beauty of the setting sun, casting golden hues over tranquil waters. We’ll return to Cormoran Lodge for dinner and a restful evening. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

After breakfast, take time to relax and soak in the beautiful views surrounding the Coromon Lodge. Sip coffee on your balcony or take a leisurely stroll on the beach— this morning is yours to enjoy. In the afternoon, we return to the peaceful waters of Lake Kivu for a boat tour. We’ll glide across its calm waters, admiring the scenic views of Rwanda’s green hillsides and the sparkling expanses of the lake. Keep an eye out for birds like herons and kingfishers as they swoop near the water and spot local fishermen casting their nets. We’ll reach Peace Island, an idyllic gem nestled on Lake Kivu, where we’ll disembark. Learn more about local flora and fauna, and enjoy the incredible views of its blooming vegetation. Stroll along the shore, explore the island’s walking paths, or take a rest at one of the many peaceful spots around the island for reflection. The quiet ambiance of Peace Island is the perfect setting to enjoy the sunset, watching the sky transform into a stunning palette of oranges and pinks that reflect serenely on the water. Today is the day to bask in the beauty of Rwanda’s wilderness and natural landscapes. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

Today, we’ll embark on a scenic speedboat journey from Kibuye to Gisenyi. Admire the breathtaking sights of Lake Kivu, from the rolling hills and shorelines to picturesque islands in the horizon. Along the way, keep an eye out for vibrant wildlife that thrives along the water. We’ll arrive in the charming lakeside town of Gisenyi and drive to Musanze, where we’ll visit the Red Rocks Cultural Center. This vibrant community space is dedicated to preserving and sharing Rwandan culture. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to meet local artisans, see their artwork, and even learn how to weave traditional baskets. You’ll also learn about the process of brewing banana beer, a Rwandan staple, and get a firsthand look into how this unique brew is made. Afterwards, drive to Ingagi Park View Lodge where we’ll enjoy dinner and stay for the next three nights. The rest of the evening is yours to unwind and relax—be sure to savor the stunning panoramic views of the volcanoes in the nearby Volcanoes National Park! Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

We’ll begin the day with an early breakfast before heading to the Kinigi Park headquarters, where we’ll meet our National Park guides. Our journey brings us to Volcanoes National Park on an easy-to-moderate hike in search of the famous Golden Monkeys. Local porters are available to carry your backpack and assist you through the dense forest. The monkeys are accustomed to human visitors and are usually very social and fun to watch. Though viewing is kept to about an hour, expect an up-close look at these wonderful monkeys in their natural habitat. Adult monkeys frolic in the trees, feeding on bamboo leaves and leaping from perch to perch. Females carry their youngest and don’t appear bothered by our presence. After leaving the forest, we’ll sit down for lunch and then we’ll visit the Ellen DeGeneres Campus of the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund. Built in 2022 and made possible through the support of Ellen DeGeneres, this world-class research and education center honors the legacy of primatologist Dian Fossey and supports her work for mountain gorilla conservation. This meaningful experience includes learning about a gorilla’s life cycle, meeting digital representations of famous gorillas Dian Fossey studied, visiting a reproduction of Dian’s cabin, and discovering more about the gorilla populations in neighboring countries. We’ll return to Ingagi Park View Lodge for dinner and a quiet evening to recharge. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

Following an early breakfast, we proceed to the National Park headquarters to meet our gorilla guides. The guides complete final paperwork and then we embark on a once-in-a-lifetime experience of tracking mountain gorillas. The trekking can be strenuous depending on where our assigned gorilla family is located, so being capable of walking on uneven ground in hot and humid conditions is a must. Local porters are available to carry your backpack and assist in traversing through tricky sections along the way. Once we spot the gorillas, we are allowed to spend an hour watching our closest mammal cousin. This is perhaps one of the most breathtaking wildlife experiences on earth! You get so close to these awesome giant primates, often staring into their soulful eyes. These massive primates are extremely rare; only 1,000-1,100 mountain gorillas exist today. We often get within feet of these gentle giants and are privileged to spend an hour amongst them. In the afternoon, we visit Handspun Hope, an organization that provides economic opportunity and vocational training to local women. The members create handmade textile products and we’ll spend the afternoon learning more about this traditional process of spinning and dyeing. After, we return to the lodge for dinner and one last overnight. Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Included.

Following breakfast at the lodge, we head back to Kigali to prepare for your journey home. We’ll have lunch together in Kigali and head to the airport. The Kigali airport can take a long time to get through to the gates, so you will need to leave a few hours early to make ample time for security screenings. You should schedule your departing flight after 3 PM. We hope you’ve enjoyed this once-in-a-lifetime experience, seeing gorillas up-close and a chance to get to know a truly unique and progressive culture in Eastern Africa. Breakfast & Lunch Included.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Kigali - Arrive at Kigali International Airport, where you will be met by your driver/guide. After exchanging money into local currency, transfer to your hotel for check-in and an overnight stay. Enjoy the hotel’s amenities. Overnight: One Click Hotel

Transfer to Akagera National Park & Sunset Boat Cruise - After an early breakfast, depart Kigali for a 2.5-hour drive to Akagera National Park in the Kayonza district. The journey includes planned stopovers, and you may request additional photo stops. On arrival, check into your lodge. Later, enjoy a sunset boat cruise on Lake Ihema, with the chance to see hippos, crocodiles, and shoreline wildlife. Return to the lodge for dinner and rest. Overnight: Mantis Akagera Game Lodge (BD)

Full-Day Safari in Akagera National Park - After breakfast, depart for a full-day game drive through Akagera National Park, one of East Africa’s most scenic savannah reserves. Wildlife sightings may include the Big Five—lion, rhino, elephant, buffalo, and leopard—as well as antelope species, kob, and baboons. The park is also home to over 500 bird species. In the afternoon, return to Kigali for an overnight stay. Overnight: One Click Hotel (B)

Travel to Nyungwe National Park via Nyanza - After breakfast, begin with a short Kigali city tour, including a visit to the Kigali Genocide Memorial. Continue southwest toward Nyungwe National Park, passing Rwanda’s characteristic terraced hills. Stop in Nyanza for a guided visit to the King’s Palace, a reconstruction of the traditional royal residence. Proceed to Nyungwe, check into your guest house, and enjoy the facilities. Overnight: Ken Barham Guest House (B)

Chimpanzee Trekking & Canopy Walk - Enjoy an early breakfast before departing for chimpanzee trekking in Nyungwe Forest. The park is home to an estimated 400–500 chimpanzees, including those in the Cyamudongo Forest. Listen for their vocal “pant-hoots” as you track through the forest. Bird sightings may include the Ross’ turaco, grey-cheeked hornbill, red-breasted sparrow hawk, and regal sunbird. In the afternoon, take the Nyungwe Canopy Walk for a treetop perspective of the forest. Overnight: Ken Barham Guest House (B)

Tea Plantation Experience & Transfer to Lake Kivu - After breakfast, take part in a tea plantation experience near Nyungwe, learning traditional tea-picking techniques and interacting with local community members. Later, transfer to the shores of Lake Kivu (Kibuye side). Spend the evening at leisure, enjoying the lakeside setting and hotel amenities. Overnight: Rwiza Cultural Village (B)

Lake Kivu Boat Cruise & Coffee Experience - Begin the day with a morning boat cruise on Lake Kivu, exploring its islands and scenic surroundings. Afterwards, drive to Volcanoes National Park, with a stop at the Kopakaki Cooperative for a guided Rwandan coffee experience. Continue to your lodge for check-in and rest. Overnight: Home Inn Hotel (B)

Gorilla Trekking & Cultural Experience - After an early breakfast, transfer to Volcanoes National Park headquarters for your gorilla trekking briefing. Receive safety information and trekking guidelines before setting off with your guides. Upon locating the mountain gorillas, spend one hour observing them in their natural habitat. Return to your lodge and later participate in a cultural visit at the Gorilla Guardians Village (formerly Iby’iwacu). Overnight: Home Inn Hotel (B)

Bisoke Volcano Hike (Optional) - Depart early for Volcanoes National Park headquarters and join your hiking group for the Bisoke Volcano trek. The hike covers approximately 6–7 hours round-trip, including a two-hour descent. Ascend through rainforest habitats home to mountain gorillas and golden monkeys, reaching a crater lake at the summit of Mount Bisoke (3,711 m). Return to the base, meet your driver-guide, and return to the hotel for an evening at leisure. Participation is optional; guests may remain at the hotel instead. Overnight: Home Inn Hotel (B)

Golden Monkey Trekking & Return to Kigali - Start the morning at Volcanoes National Park headquarters for your Golden Monkey trekking briefing. Trek through bamboo forest terrain to locate the habituated troops, and spend approximately one hour observing them. Afterwards, transfer back to Kigali (approx. 2.5 hours). Drop-off is provided at your hotel or Kigali International Airport. Note: Flights should not be scheduled to depart before 6:00 pm.

tourName: Rwanda tour and luxury gorilla safari

In Rwanda, people treasure a visit with the endangered Silverback Mountain gorillas who are surprisingly playful and relaxed in human presence. This tour ensures you have a life time memorable experience.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL- ENTEBBE Today you will arrive at Entebbe Airport. Upon clearance, you shall finalize immigration formalities and exit the Airport to be received by your guide. Transfer will be arranged to your hotel which is only 20 minutes from the airport. Dinner on own arrangements. Meal Plan: Breakfast

ARRIVE IN ENTEBBE. FLIGHT TO BWINDI IMPENETRABLE NATIONAL PARK After breakfast and checkout, transfer will be arranged to Entebbe airport to check in for your flight to Bwindi departing from Entebbe at 07:00hr or midday and arrive in Bwindi at 08:15hr or 09:30hr or 14:40hr. You will be picked from the airstrip by your guide to start your journey to Bwindi impenetrable national park. The journey will lead you through the green countryside. You will arrive at your lodge in time for lunch. Bwindi impenetrable national park is a magnificent green swathe of dense rainforest and is one of the most biologically diverse areas on earth. It is a habitat for nearly 350 birds’ species, 120 mammals and other insect species. The park is home to the endangered mountain Gorillas.

GORILLA TREKKING IN BWINDI Early morning breakfast. Begin your gorilla trek early in the morning and set off into the tangled and mist-shrouded forests with guides and trackers who are very experienced at locating the gorillas by finding the nest the family had used the previous night. Watching gorillas in their natural habitat is a memory that will last a lifetime. The experienced ranger guides will willingly share with you a lot of information about the history and lifestyle of the Gorillas. After spending an hour with the gorillas, we head back to the lodge and relax. You may do any optional activities around Bwindi this evening.

DRIVE TO AIRSTRIP. FLIGHT TO ENTEBBE AND DEPARTURE After breakfast you will check out of your accommodation to drive back to the Airstrip. From here you will take a flight to Entebbe airport. The flight departs from the airstrip at 08:30hr or 09:30hr and arrives in Entebbe at 11:25hr. In Entebbe you shall check in for your departure flight to the next destination. MEAL PLAN: BREAKFAST

tourName: Rwanda tour, tailor made
placesVisited: City walking tour in Kigali, Genocide Memorial Museum, day with the community in Muhanga village, Nyungwe National Park canopy walk, Chimpanzee tracking in Cyamudongo Forest, Lake Kivu kayak and island camping, Congo Nile Trail, Rubava (formely Gisenyi), mountain biking around Musanze, Volcanoes National Park, Mukungwa River canoe trip, track mountain gorillas
generalInfo:
Rwanda is a country that does nature tourism exactly right - come and celebrate its success for yourself. Underneath the canopies of its forested hills you’ll find one of the best places in the world for meeting mountain gorillas. Rwanda tours take in the country's cultural and natural highlights. Witness and participate with some of the brilliant Rwandan, community businesses that empower locals

Your tour starts in Kigali, the capital, where you can throw yourself into the local market, before recovering at one of the city’s many milk bars with a glass of fermented, sweetened milk – before a trip to the important Kigali Genocide Memorial Museum.

You’ll get a chance to visit East Africa’s largest rainforest at Nyungwe National Park, known for its chimpanzees. The forest is perhaps best experienced with an inspiring, but dizzying, canopy walk through the trees. From the park you’ll go to Cyamudongo Forest, a small fragment of nearby forest surrounded by tea plantations. This forest is smaller than Nyungwe National Park, making is an even better place to track and then spot chimpanzees on a walking tour.

From here you’ll head to Lake Kivu, a vast, peaceful body of water between Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The best way to experience it is by boat – whether you’re kayaking, or going by motorboat to meet the fishermen heading out from Rubavu to fish for the night, singing as they go. You’ll camp on the lakeshore – look out for bats flitting overhead at dusk.

The Virunga Volcanoes are next on the horizon. Your trip culminates with a visit to Virunga National Park’s most famous residents. After tracking down a gorilla family your permit will allow you an hour sitting with a gorilla group high in the mountains. You’ll learn how to approach the gorillas; once you’re in their midst, you’ll be mesmerised.

This tour doesn’t just show you Rwanda’s big hitters. After exploring Kigali, you’ll go on to Muhanga village, where you can spend the night at a homestay, help around the village and get to know your hosts. You’ll also get to visit lesser-explored areas – such as the Mukungwa River, where you’ll probably be the only people birdwatching from your canoes, and the farmlands outside of Musanze, where exploring by electric bike means you can stop and meet people as you explore the area.

The price of this trip includes the price of a low season permit to meet the gorillas. The money you pay for this permit funds important research projects, healthcare, and ongoing protection of the mountain gorillas – once you meet them, you’ll know this was money well spent.

dayInfo.description: You will be met at the airport by your guide and transferred to your hotel in Kigali. Depending on your arrival time you may want to relax or opt to start your adventure with a tour of Kigali. Take a guided walking city tour of Kigali to familiarize yourself with the area. The tour includes a visit to a busy local market and the sampling of some local produce. You will also have the opportunity to relax in a local milk bar, the Rwandan equivalent to a coffee shop! An afternoon visit to the Genocide Memorial Museum is also possible. While this is a tough experience it provides an opportunity to both understand the history of this tragic event and also to pay your respects at the memorial. Furthermore it outlines the current efforts being made to create a brighter future for all Rwandans. Overnight Heaven Boutique Hotel or similar.

Nyamirambo Women's Center offers tourists a uniquely personal insight into the culture, history, and daily life of their community. All of the tour guides either grew up in Nyamirambo or live there, so the tours truly are a welcome into their home. Profits from the tours also go back into the Centre. Walking Tour of Nyamirambo The walking tour begins at the Women’s Center with a traditional snack, a quick Kinyarwanda language lesson, and an introduction to the Center and its activities. It then weaves through Nyamirambo, one of Kigali’s oldest neighborhoods. nto a family compound to pound cassava leaves; by two mosques and a lookout view over Kigali; and into a tailor shop to feel the fabrics you'll otherwise see styled on the streets. The tour concludes with an (optional) traditional lunch made and served in the home of Aminatha, NWC's best cook! In the afternoon we visit Camp Kigali Belgian Monument is built in memory of 10 Belgian UN Blue Beret soldiers who were massacred in this area trying to protect the late prime minister Agatha Uwiringiyimana who was against Genocide against the Tutsi and anyone who supported Tutsi. Then - The Kigali Genocide Memorial is a place of remembrance & learning where you will have time to reflect on a tragic time in Rwanda’s past. As you walk around the memorial and think about and remember the victims, 250,000 of whom have their final resting place here, you will be moved by the shocking events that led up to and took place during the genocide. Overnight in Heaven Boutique Hotel or Similar.

Azizi Life was begun to honor the initiatives and work of the artisans and serve as a bridge to customers around the world. These artisans were doing some great job but sometimes couldn't even cover the cost of the used raw materials while selling to their neighbours or with the help of a middleman. Become part of a weaving cooperative for the day. The Azizi Life Experience morning begins with a drive to a nearby village, where you and your Azizi Life interpreter will be welcomed by the ladies of the weaving cooperative.You’ll share a simple local meal with your host family, with plenty of time to chat and learn about each other’s lives. After lunch, you will join with the artisan cooperative for an afternoon of weaving. A reconstruction of the traditional royal residence, the King’s Palace is a beautifully-crafted thatched dwelling shaped like a beehive.In olden times, Nyanza was the heart of Rwanda. According to oral tradition, it was the site of battles and power struggles. For a long time, the monarchy was mobile, moving the court between various locations. When it eventually settled in one place, Nyanza was the obvious choice. The capital of the kingdom had as many as 2,000 inhabitants, and huts built with the same methods as seen here. At the back live a few long-horned Inyambo cattle, descended from the king’s herd, whose keepers carefully tend and sing to them, keeping alive a unique tradition. Overnight in the Centre d'acceuil Mater Boni Consilii

Today you will visit Nyungwe National Park. A beautifully preserved forest that covers an area of over 1000sq km Nyungwe National Park is home to over 300 bird species, many butterflies, orchids, and 75 mammal species including 13 primates. With your personal input your guide will arrange a hike that is the right option for you; there are several options for different abilities so everyone can experience the trekking in the park. You can choose to walk the Canopy Trail, approximately a 2 hour trail through the forest that includes the “canopy walk”. This refers to a foot bridge located 50m high, and around 90m long, high above the forest. Not for the faint hearted but worth it for the views! In the afternoon check in at your hotel. Overnight Top View Hotel or similar

An early start (around 5am) for your chimpanzee tracking experience! Drive to Cyamudongo Forest, a reserve located approximately an 1½ hours from Nyungwe which has an habituated population of chimpanzees. After meeting up with your tracker you will head out to into the forest in search of the chimpanzees and then spend an hour observing them in the forest. As our closest living relative, chimpanzees share 98.7% DNA, it’s an exhilarating experience to observe them in the wild. Chimpanzees communicate with pant hoots, screams, and by hitting the tree buttress so you may hear them before you actually see them! The length of the walk and the time taken to find the group will vary, so prepare for a long walk through the forest. The chimpanzees can be seen as they move through the tree canopy, or as they travel along the forest floor. After your time with the chimpanzees you will drive on towards Lake Kivu for a late lunch. Overnight Nyungwe Top View Hill Hotel (Standard cottage)

The local visit to Gisakura tea plantation will enable you experience and learn the art of picking tea leaves, wander through the lush tea estate to adventure close the variety of parallel ridges of tea plus the attractive mountains and hills that provide a beautiful back drop for the plantation. You will learn how tea is grown and harvested, the best tea leaves to pick and how to pick them before you put them in an open traditional basket which you will be carrying on your back. After the picking process you will then experience how tea is processed locally by pounding the leaves and drying them, then after checking the well finished product you will do the tasting your own made cup of tea. NOTE: We will be hiking/walking through the small trails heading to the tea estate where our tea picking will start from, however, if you are the adventurous type you can opt for an optional tea tour with mountain bikes from the starting point to the tea estates and return to the base where the tour ends on your bikes. This is also another good way to explore beautiful trails around Gisakura estates. You will be transferred by road from Nyungwe Forest National Park to your hotel on the shores of Lake Kivu in Karongi. The journey is approximately 208 km and will take between 4 to 5 hours. Your arrival time depends on the length of the mornings activities but you may have an opportunity to enjoy a sunset kayak on the lake and perhaps see the fishermen in their boats as they head out for the night.

After breakfast at your camp site there is another opportunity for kayaking on the lake towards Rushel Kivu Lodge (approximately a distance of 2 hours). At the lodge you will transfer your bags from your support boat to your vehicle and then continue on to Cyimbili by motor boat for lunch. This afternoon you can choose to either walk a section of the Congo Nile Trail OR take a tour of the coffee fields and production plant (option to be decided in advance). Coffee production is an important source of income for the local economy. Continue your journey by motor boat towards Gisenyi and arrive in time to see the town fisherman heading out for the evening, and as they do so hear them sing. The fishermen spend the night on the water, their 3 vessels linked together with poles and nets to catch the fish, and hearing them singing as they paddled out for the night is a surprisingly moving experience. Gisenyi (renamed Rubavu in 2006) is a popular resort town with both Rwandans and visitors. (NB: The fishermen’s schedule is subject to change due to their schedule and the weather). Overnight Cormoran Lodge .

Handspun Hope in Rwanda empowers local women through the production of high-quality knitwear from merino wool. By participating in this initiative, they gain economic independence and help uplift their community. Visitors can engage with the women, learning about the entire wool production process, from shepherding to spinning and dyeing. This hands-on experience fosters appreciation for the craftsmanship involved. With a quality hard-tail mountain bike or e-bike, helmet and cycling gloves provided, you'll explore the Rwandan countryside on the many small tracks and trails that criss-cross the landscape. The twin lakes of Ruhondo and Burera are two lakes separated by 1km strip of land and produced by volcanic eruptions. This cycle will give you an opportunity to view all the 5 Rwanda volcanoes, this depends on the weather condition. This is a great way to explore the outskirts of Volcanoes. Overnight Isange Paradise resort or similar 2 nights Depending on your fitness level, we can adjust the routing to something relatively easier.

Experience a unique adventure tracking the endangered Golden Monkeys in Volcanoes National Park. Start with an early morning meet-up at 07:00 and begin hiking at 08:00 through lush forests, guided to a troop of 40-100 playful monkeys. Spend an hour observing their lively interactions and leaping from tree to tree. Your visit supports conservation efforts, helping protect these monkeys and their habitat. Bird lovers may also spot the striking Blue Turaco along the trails. This eco-tour offers an unforgettable glimpse into the lives of these rare primates. Enjoy a serene canoe trip in the Virunga Volcanoes foothills, spotting birds, otters, and stunning countryside views. Guided by an expert from Kingfisher Journey, this mostly gentle river has a short rapid for added excitement. Begin with a briefing near Musanze, then paddle downstream for 2.5-3 hours, navigating scenic rural Rwanda. The journey concludes with a drive back to Musanze

An early start today as you will track mountain gorillas! Take an early morning short drive to Kinigi, where the Volcanoes National Park headquarters are located, you need to be there by 7am or you risk invalidating your precious permits! You will then be introduced to your park guide who will take time to explain where exactly you will be trekking, which gorilla group you have been assigned to track and the guidelines you needed to follow when in the mountain gorilla’s presence. Around 8am you will start trekking through the fields and farm land surrounding the park until you reach the border of the Volcanoes National Park. Trekking is at elevations of 2500-3000m, so at times breathing can become a conscious effort as you move through the thick vegetation towards the gorillas. The distance you walk is entirely dependent on the mountain gorilla group movements. Excitement mounts as you approach the group and finally get to enjoy your time in their presence. Your guide will reassure and calmed the gorillas with deep grunts, and you will be encouraged to do the same. After an hour with the Mountain gorillas you will trek back to Kinigi. After your trek you will enjoy a well earned lunch before making the return journey to Kigali and have time to visit the Ellen DeGeneres Campus of the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund is to see gorilla conservation in action. Building on Dian Fossey's pioneering work, now that gorilla populations of the Virunga Volcanoes are slowly increasing and their habitats are being protected, this centre is a highly recommended, remarkable place to visit. Mountain gorillas have been monitored and studied closely since Dian Fossey began her work with them in 1967, after establishing the Karisoke Research Center.
